      48           1 : static void set_initialized_array_size(a_type_ptr    *type,
      49             :                                        a_targ_size_t size,
      50             :                                        a_boolean     unknown_dependent)
      51             : /*
      52             : Change *type to point to a new array type that is the same as the current
      53             : *type except that its number of elements is changed to "size".  If
      54             : unknown_dependent is TRUE, the size is dependent but unknown (size is
      55             : ignored).  This is used to set the length of an incomplete array when
      56             : its size becomes known because it is initialized.  The original type
      57             : may be shared, and therefore a copy is made and modified.
      58             : */
      59             : {
      60           1 :   a_type_ptr array_type, incomplete_type = skip_typerefs(*type);
      61             : 
      62           1 :   check_assertion(!has_unknown_specified_bound(incomplete_type));
      63           1 :   array_type = alloc_type((a_type_kind)tk_array);
      64           1 :   copy_type(incomplete_type, array_type);
      65           1 :   if (unknown_dependent) {
      66           0 :     array_type->variant.array.is_template_dependent_size_array = TRUE;
      67           0 :     array_type->variant.array.variant.element_count_constant = NULL;
      68             :   } else {
      69           1 :     array_type->variant.array.variant.number_of_elements = size;
      70           1 :     if (size == 0) {
      71             :       /* In GNU C and C++ mode, an empty pair of braces can be a valid
      72             :          initializer for a zero-length array.  In C++11, this is also
      73             :          possible with something like "new T[n]{}". */
      74           0 :       array_type->variant.array.bound_is_zero = TRUE;
      75             :     }  /* if */
      76             :   }  /* if */
      77           1 :   set_type_size(array_type);
      78           1 :   *type = array_type;
      79           1 : }  /* set_initialized_array_size */

     101           1 : a_boolean check_string_constant_initializer_full(a_type_ptr      *dst_type,

     103             :                                                  a_boolean       *excess)
     104             : /*
     105             : *dst_type is an array of narrow or wide characters (or an array whose element
     106             : type is template dependent).  Return TRUE if and only if a variable or field of
     107             : that type can be initialized with the given string literal.  If excess is non-
     108             : NULL, an overlong string literal is not treated as an error but causes *excess
     109             : to be set to TRUE.  If the string literal is not too long (which includes the
     110             : standard C behavior of trimming the terminating null character if needed),
     111             : *excess is set to FALSE.  If necessary, the string literal is truncated to fit
     112             : *dst_type or *dst_type may be modified (e.g., to set the length of the string).
     113             : */

     287        5459 : static void gen_dynamic_initialization(
     288             :                                   a_variable_ptr        vp,
     289             :                                   a_dynamic_init_ptr    dip,
     290             :                                   a_local_static_variable_init_ptr
     291             :                                                         *local_static_var_init,
     292             :                                   a_source_position     *source_pos,
     293             :                                   a_decl_pos_block_ptr  decl_pos_block,
     294             :                                   a_statement_ptr       *p_init_stmt)
     295             : /*
     296             : Generate a dynamic initialization of the variable vp based on the
     297             : dynamic init entry pointed to by dip.  Except for a dynamic
     298             : initialization at file scope (possible only in C++), also create an
     299             : stmk_init statement at the current point in the code.  If the
     300             : variable is a local static variable, a_local_variable_init entry
     301             : will be used to initialize it, and a pointer to the entry is returned
     302             : in *local_static_var_init.  *source_pos is the source position for an
     303             : error (dynamic initialization is in unreachable code).  If p_init_stmt
     304             : is non-NULL, *p_init_stmt is set to point to the stmk_init statement
     305             : created, or NULL it there is none.  decl_pos_block is non-NULL, if the
     306             : dynamic initialization corresponds to an actual initializer in the
     307             : source; in that case, it points to position information that should be
     308             : recorded in the stmk_init statement.
     309             : */
     310             : {

     431             :     }  /* if */
     432        5353 :     init_stmt->variant.dynamic_init = dip;
     433        5353 :     update_init_statement_control_flow(init_stmt);
     434             :   }  /* if */
     435             :   /* Mark all dynamically initialized variables as referenced.  (They are
     436             :      "referenced" in the sense that a variable assigned to, even if never
     437             :      used, is referenced.)  It is especially important not to leave the
     438             :      referenced flag unset when the initialization (e.g., by constructor)
     439             :      may have side effects. */
     440        5459 :   vp->source_corresp.referenced = TRUE;
     441        5459 :   db_exit();
     442        5459 : }  /* gen_dynamic_initialization */
     443             : 
     444             : 
     445           1 : static void put_type_back_into_variable(a_variable_ptr     vp,
     446             :                                         a_symbol_ptr       symbol_ptr,
     447             :                                         a_source_position  *source_pos,
     448             :                                         an_id_linkage_kind linkage,
     449             :                                         a_type_ptr         vp_type)
     450             : /*
     451             : Put the type vp_type back into the variable vp.  symbol_ptr points to
     452             : the symbol associated with vp; *source_pos indicates the source position
     453             : of the declaration of the variable; linkage indicates the linkage of the
     454             : variable.  vp_type has been updated as a result of initialization, i.e.,
     455             : vp had an incomplete array type that has been completed by an initializer.
     456             : */
     457             : {
     458           1 :   a_symbol_ptr         ext_sym;
     459           1 :   a_name_linkage_kind  name_linkage;
     460           1 :   a_symbol_locator     locator, ext_locator;
     461           1 :   a_boolean            is_array = is_array_type(vp_type);
     462             : 
     463           1 :   db_enter(5, "put_type_back_into_variable");
     464           1 :   check_assertion(is_array_type(vp->type) && is_incomplete_type(vp->type));
     465             :   /* See if the variable has linkage. */
     466           1 :   if (symbol_is(symbol_ptr, sk_variable) && linkage != idl_none &&
     467           1 :       !vp->is_template_variable && !is_template_dependent_context()) {
     468             :     /* The type of a variable with linkage has been adjusted because it is an
     469             :        incomplete array that has been initialized.  Check that the new type is
     470             :        compatible with other declarations of the variable.  This is necessary
     471             :        for cases like
     472             :          main () {extern char a[5];}
     473             :          char a[] = "abc";  <-- Error; int [3] is incompatible with int [5].
     474             :        Instances of variable templates cannot be linked with other
     475             :        external symbols.  In addition, in prototype instantiations variables
     476             :        with linkage aren't really allocated and should therefore not be
     477             :        unified with other declarations. */
     478           1 :     make_locator_for_symbol(symbol_ptr, &locator);
     479           1 :     if (!is_error_locator(locator)) {
     480           1 :       name_linkage = symbol_ptr->
     481           1 :                            variant.variable.ptr->source_corresp.name_linkage;
     482           1 :       ext_sym = find_external_symbol(&locator, name_linkage,
     483             :                                      (a_type_ptr)NULL, &ext_locator);
     484           1 :       check_assertion(ext_sym != NULL);
     485           1 :       (void)reconcile_external_symbol_types(ext_sym, source_pos, vp_type,
     486             :                                             es_error);
     487             :     }  /* if */
     488             :   }  /* if */
     489             :   /* An empty aggregate initializer ({}) is not valid for an array variable
     490             :      with unspecified bound, except in GNU mode (where the type of the
     491             :      initializer is complete). */
     492           1 :   if (is_incomplete_type(vp_type) ||
     493           1 :       (!gnu_mode && is_array &&
     494           0 :        skip_typerefs(vp_type)->variant.array.bound_is_zero)) {
     495           0 :     if (is_array && is_or_contains_error_type(array_element_type(vp_type))) {
     496             :       /* If something went wrong with the element type, additional errors are
     497             :          unlikely to be helpful. */
     498           0 :       expect_error();
     499             :     } else {
     500           0 :       pos_error(ec_bad_initializer_for_array_with_unspecified_bound,
     501             :                 source_pos);
     502             :     }  /* if */

     510             : 
     511           1 : static void pop_object_lifetime_for_local_static_init(
     512             :                         an_object_lifetime_ptr           local_static_lifetime,
     513             :                         a_local_static_variable_init_ptr local_static_var_init,
     514             :                         a_boolean                        err)
     515             : /*
     516             : An object lifetime was previously pushed to surround the initialization of
     517             : a local static variable; local_static_lifetime identifies it.  Bind it
     518             : to the local static variable initializer entry at local_static_var_init,
     519             : and pop it off the object lifetime stack.  err is TRUE if some error has been
     520             : detected in the initialization.  local_static_var_init is NULL if this
     521             : variable did not require dynamic initialization, if which case the lifetime
     522             : is not needed.
     523             : */
     524             : {
     525           1 :   a_boolean  suppress_warning;
     526             : 
     527           1 :   check_assertion(local_static_lifetime == curr_object_lifetime);
     528           1 :   if (err) mark_object_lifetime_as_useless(local_static_lifetime);
     529             :   /* Note that the lifetime is for recovery if an exception is thrown during
     530             :      the initialization of the local static variable.  So the test here is
     531             :      not for the lifetime having anything in it, but rather for whether there's
     532             :      anything in the initialization that might throw, in which case the
     533             :      lifetime is needed. */
     534           1 :   if ((local_static_var_init == NULL ||
     535           0 :        local_static_var_init->init_kind != (an_init_kind)initk_dynamic ||
     536           0 :        !dynamic_init_has_side_effects(local_static_var_init->
     537             :                                                initializer.dynamic,
     538             :                                       /*for_unused_var=*/FALSE,
     539           1 :                                       &suppress_warning)) &&
     540           1 :       is_useless_object_lifetime(local_static_lifetime)) {
     541             :     /* Don't bind the object lifetime, allowing it to be deleted on the pop.
     542             :        (Being bound to a local static init is one of the things that makes
     543             :        a lifetime useful, so doing the binding would prevent it from being
     544             :        removed.)  The is_useless_object_lifetime test is there for error cases
     545             :        where something destructible has been recorded even though the final
     546             :        initializer ends up having no side effects.  We keep the extra
     547             :        object lifetime in that case, just to make things easier. */
     548             :   } else {
     549           0 :     bind_object_lifetime(local_static_lifetime,
     550             :                          (an_il_entry_kind)
     551             :                              iek_local_static_variable_init,
     552             :                          (char *)local_static_var_init);
     553             :   }  /* if */
     554           1 :   (void)pop_object_lifetime();
     555           1 : }  /* pop_object_lifetime_for_local_static_init */
     556             : 
     557             :

     696         145 : static void aggr_init_simple_element(an_init_component_ptr  *p_icp,
     697             :                                      a_type_ptr             dest_type,
     698             :                                      an_init_state          *is,
     699             :                                      a_constant_ptr         *init_con)
     700             : /*
     701             : *p_icp is a single element in an aggregate initialization described by *is.
     702             : Ordinarily, *p_icp initializes an array element or a field of type dest_type,
     703             : but in error cases it could also be an invalid designator.
     704             : Return a constant in *init_con describing the element-level initialization, and
     705             : update *p_icp to the next component to be consumed.
     706             : The presence of a nonconstant initializer component is reflected in *is.
     707             : */
     708             : {
     709         145 :   an_init_component_ptr  orig_icp = *p_icp, icp = orig_icp;

     712         145 : remove_any_extraneous_braces:

     714           0 :     a_type_ptr dtype = skip_typerefs(dest_type);
     715           0 :     if (is_reference_type(dtype)) {
     716             :       /* Braces are not necessarily redundant: Initializing a reference amounts
     717             :          to initializing a temporary bound to that reference.  If the temporary
     718             :          has an aggregate type, the braces are not redundant.  Either way, this
     719             :          will be handled at the time the temporary initialization is processed.
     720             :          */
     721           0 :     } else if (is_immediate_class_type(dtype)) {

     959          10 : static void aggr_init_generic_element(an_init_component_ptr  icp,
     960             :                                       a_type_ptr             gtype,

    1078           0 : static void aggr_init_vector(an_init_component_ptr  *p_icp,
    1079             :                              a_type_ptr             vtype,
    1080             :                              an_init_state          *is,
    1081             :                              a_source_position      *diag_pos,
    1082             :                              a_constant_ptr         *init_con)
    1083             : /*
    1084             : Produce an aggregate constant (in *init_con) for the initialization of a GNU
    1085             : vector type (vtype).  The initializer is described by *p_icp, and that value
    1086             : is updated to the next initializer to be considered by the caller (if the
    1087             : initializer is braced, just one initializer is "consumed", but otherwise
    1088             : multiple components may be used for this initialization).  *is describes the
    1089             : initialization as a whole.  diag_pos is the default position for

    1093           0 :   an_init_component_ptr  icp = *p_icp;

    1198           0 : static void aggr_init_complex(an_init_component_ptr  *p_icp,

    1254             : 
    1255           0 : static a_constant_ptr default_nontrivial_init_constant_for_aggr_member(
    1256             :                                                  a_type_ptr         tp,
    1257             :                                                  an_init_state      *is,
    1258             :                                                  a_source_position  *diag_pos)
    1259             : /*
    1260             : Return a constant representing the generated default initializer for an
    1261             : aggregate member requiring nontrivial initialization (i.e., a default
    1262             : constructor must be called, and/or a destructor must be recorded in case an
    1263             : exception aborts the initialization).  tp is the type of the member.  *is
    1264             : tracks the initialization as a whole and may be updated by this routine (e.g.,
    1265             : to indicate that an error occurred).  Diagnostics should be issued at the
    1266             : given position, unless is->no_diagnostics is TRUE.
    1267             : */
    1268             : {
    1269           0 :   a_constant_ptr  result = NULL;
    1270             : 
    1271           0 :   if (list_init_enabled &&
    1272           0 :       !clang_version_is(< 30500) && !gpp_version_is(< 40700) &&
    1273           0 :       !(microsoft_mode && (!cpp11_mode || implicit_microsoft_cpp11_mode))) {
    1274             :     /* C++11 changed the rules from requiring a value-initialization (i.e.,
    1275             :        the C++03 requirement of picking the default constructor) to saying
    1276             :        that the initialization is "as if" initializing with an empty
    1277             :        initializer list.  For example:
    1278             :           #include <initializer_list>
    1279             :           struct S { S(std::initializer_list<int>); };
    1280             :           S x[1] = {};  // Valid in C++11.
    1281             :        Some C++11 compilers (e.g., clang 3.4) do not implement this yet and
    1282             :        give an error on this example because S has no default constructor. */
    1283           0 :     an_init_component_ptr  icp, orig_icp;
    1284           0 :     icp = alloc_init_component((an_init_component_kind)ick_braced);
    1285           0 :     icp->variant.braced.start_pos = *diag_pos;
    1286           0 :     icp->variant.braced.end_pos = *diag_pos;
    1287           0 :     orig_icp = icp;
    1288           0 :     aggr_init_element(&icp, tp, is, diag_pos, &result);
    1289           0 :     free_init_component_list(orig_icp);
    1290             :   } else {
    1291           0 :     a_dynamic_init_ptr  dip = NULL;
    1292           0 :     a_routine_ptr       ctor_rp, dtor_rp = NULL;

    1516           0 : static a_constant_ptr implicit_init_anonymous_union_member(

    1590           0 : static a_boolean implicit_init_involves_ref_init(a_type_ptr tp)

    1655           0 : static a_constant_ptr repeat_constant_for_array_init(a_constant_ptr  cp,

    1685             : 
    1686           8 : static a_boolean try_string_literal_init(an_init_component_ptr  icp,
    1687             :                                          a_type_ptr             *p_array_type,
    1688             :                                          an_init_state          *is,
    1689             :                                          a_constant_ptr         *result)
    1690             : /*
    1691             : If the given initializer component is a valid string initializer for the given
    1692             : array type, return TRUE and record the IL representation for that initializer
    1693             : in *result (unless is->check_validity_only is TRUE).  Otherwise, return FALSE.
    1694             : If TRUE is returned and *p_array_type represents an array with no specified
    1695             : bound, replace *p_array_type with an array type corresponding to the string
    1696             : size.
    1697             : */
    1698             : {
    1699           8 :   a_boolean  success = FALSE;
    1700             : 
    1701           8 :   if (may_be_string_type(*p_array_type)) {
    1702           3 :     a_constant_ptr  string_constant;
    1703             :     /* Permit an extra level of braces (but only if the braces enclose a
    1704             :        single element). */
    1705           3 :     if (is_braced_init_component(icp) &&
    1706           2 :         is_single_elem(icp->variant.braced.list)) {
    1707           1 :       icp = icp->variant.braced.list;
    1708             :     }  /* if */
    1709           3 :     if (icp != NULL && is_string_literal_component(icp, &string_constant)) {
    1710           1 :       a_type_ptr  orig_string_type = string_constant->type;
    1711           1 :       a_boolean   excess = FALSE, *p_excess = gcc_mode ? &excess : NULL;
    1712           1 :       success = TRUE;
    1713           1 :       if (check_string_constant_initializer_full(p_array_type, string_constant,
    1714             :                                                  p_excess)) {
    1715           1 :         if (!is->check_validity_only) {
    1716           1 :           *result = alloc_unshared_constant(string_constant);
    1717             :         }  /* if */
    1718           2 :         if (!has_unknown_specified_bound(*p_array_type) &&
    1719           1 :             num_array_elements(*p_array_type) >
    1720           1 :                                   num_array_elements(string_constant->type)) {
    1721           1 :           is->partial_initializer = TRUE;
    1722             :         }  /* if */
    1723           1 :         if (strict_ansi_mode && !list_init_enabled && !is->no_diagnostics &&
    1724           0 :             is_parenthesized_component(icp)) {
    1725             :           /* Strictly speaking, the standard doesn't allow parenthesized string
    1726             :              literals for aggregate initialization.  However, with C++11-style
    1727             :              list initialization that could make overload resolution depend on
    1728             :              whether a string literal is parenthesized or not, which is not
    1729             :              desirable.  So we impose this only in strict modes that don't
    1730             :              permit generalized list initialization (typically, C++03 mode). */
    1731           0 :           pos_diagnostic(strict_ansi_discretionary_severity,
    1732             :                          ec_nonstandard_parenthesized_string_initializer,
    1733             :                          init_component_pos(icp));
    1734           1 :         } else if (excess && !is->no_diagnostics) {
    1735           0 :           pos_warning(ec_excess_characters_in_literal_ignored,
    1736             :                       init_component_pos(icp));
    1737             :         }  /* if */
    1738             :       } else {
    1739           0 :         if (is->no_diagnostics) {
    1740           0 :           is->init_error = TRUE;
    1741             :         } else {
    1742             :           /* Note: The call to check_string_constant_initializer truncates the
    1743             :              string constant if needed.  So we must use the type of the string
    1744             :              prior to that call. */
    1745           0 :           pos_ty2_error(ec_bad_initializer_type, init_component_pos(icp),
    1746             :                         orig_string_type, *p_array_type);
    1747             :         }  /* if */
    1748           0 :         if (!is->check_validity_only) {
    1749           0 :           *result = alloc_error_constant();
    1750             :         }  /* if */
    1751           0 :         if (is_incomplete_array_type(*p_array_type) && !is->no_diagnostics) {
    1752             :           /* An incomplete array initialized by an incompatible string literal.
    1753             :              For better error recovery, replace the array type by an error
    1754             :              type. */
    1755           0 :           *p_array_type = error_type();
    1756             :         }  /* if */
    1757             :       }  /* if */
    1758             :     }  /* if */
    1759             :   }  /* if */
    1760           8 :   return success;
    1761             : }  /* try_string_literal_init */
    1762             : 
    1763             : 
    1764           1 : static a_boolean try_whole_array_init(an_init_component_ptr  icp,
    1765             :                                       a_type_ptr             array_type,
    1766             :                                       a_constant_ptr         *result)
    1767             : /*
    1768             : icp represents an expression that might initialize an array of the given type
    1769             : (the whole array; not just an element of it).  If it does, return TRUE, and

    1772             : {
    1773           1 :   a_boolean  success = FALSE;
    1774             :

    1777           0 :     success = TRUE;

    1781             : 
    1782             : 
    1783           3 : static void aggr_init_array_remainder_if_needed(a_constant_ptr     array_con,
    1784             :                                                 a_targ_size_t      count,
    1785             :                                                 a_type_ptr         etype,
    1786             :                                                 an_init_state      *is,
    1787             :                                                 a_source_position  *diag_pos)
    1788             : /*
    1789             : An array of elements of type etype has an initializer that doesn't initialize
    1790             : all the array elements.  array_con points to a ck_aggregate constant that
    1791             : represents the explicit initialization (unless is->check_validity_only flag is
    1792             : FALSE).  Check that the remaining elements of the array can be initialized, and
    1793             : if the flag is->check_validity_only is FALSE and the remaining elements need
    1794             : dynamic initialization, append a constant representing that initialization to
    1795             : the list embedded in array_con (plain zero initialization is done elsewhere if
    1796             : needed).  *is describes the initialization as a whole, and diag_pos indicates
    1797             : the position at which diagnostics should be issued.
    1798             : */
    1799             : {
    1800           3 :   a_boolean  partial_init_flag = TRUE;
    1801             : 
    1802           3 :   etype = skip_typerefs(etype);
    1803           3 :   if (etype->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_array) {
    1804             :     /* The element is a sub-array.  Create a single potentially-repeated
    1805             :        initializer for all array levels. */
    1806           1 :     count *= num_array_elements(etype);
    1807           1 :     etype = underlying_array_element_type(etype);
    1808           1 :     etype = skip_typerefs(etype);
    1809             :   }  /* if */
    1810           3 :   if (count == 0) {
    1811             :     /* This can happen in GNU modes with arrays of zero-element arrays.  No
    1812             :        further initializations are needed at this level. */
    1813           0 :     check_assertion(gnu_mode);
    1814             :     partial_init_flag = FALSE;
    1815           3 :   } else if (is_real_class_type(etype)) {
    1816             :     /* It is an array of class objects. */
    1817           0 :     a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr  cssp = symbol_supplement_for_class(etype);
    1818           0 :     if (has_trivial_default_constructor(cssp) &&
    1819           0 :         (!exceptions_enabled || cssp->has_trivial_destructor)) {
    1820           0 :       if (implicit_init_involves_ref_init(etype)) {
    1821             :         /* An array element of class type with no constructor but with a ref
    1822             :            member will end up uninitialized. */
    1823           0 :         is->any_uninitialized_const_or_ref_member = TRUE;
    1824             :       }  /* if */
    1825             :       /* No initializers needed for the remaining array elements. */
    1826             :     } else {
    1827             :       /* Initialization must be represented in the IL since it is not
    1828             :          trivial. */
    1829           0 :       a_constant_ptr  remainder_con;
    1830           0 :       partial_init_flag = FALSE;
    1831             :       /* Create the element value to use for initialization.  It will be
    1832             :          placed under a ck_init_repeat entry unless no IL is generated. */
    1833           0 :       is->repeated_element = TRUE;
    1834           0 :       remainder_con = default_nontrivial_init_constant_for_aggr_member(
    1835             :                                                          etype, is, diag_pos);
    1836           0 :       is->repeated_element = FALSE;
    1837           0 :       if (!is->check_validity_only) {
    1838           0 :         remainder_con->implicit_aggr_element = TRUE;
    1839             :         /* Add the constant entry to the list of constants, but add a
    1840             :            ck_repeat_init on top of it if needed. */
    1841           0 :         check_assertion(array_con->type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_array &&
    1842             :                         array_con->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_aggregate);
    1843           0 :         if (is->variable_size_array && !is->non_top_level_aggregate) {
    1844             :           /* Something like "new T[x]{...}" where x is a run-time value.
    1845             :              We don't know a priori how many default initializations are
    1846             :              needed, but we have to represent it in some way so that lowering
    1847             :              (or a back end) knows which routine to call.  We use a zero count,
    1848             :              which somewhat matches the "incomplete array type" recorded in the
    1849             :              new/delete supplement. */
    1850           0 :           count = 0;
    1851             :           /* Since the count in this case is really a run-time value, ensure
    1852             :              that the aggregate constant as a whole won't be treated as a pure
    1853             :              constant (i.e., a dik_nonconstant_aggregate entry should be
    1854             :              produced instead of a dik_constant entry). */
    1855           0 :           is->has_dynamic_init_component = TRUE;
    1856             :         }  /* if */
    1857             :         /* Add a ck_init_repeat constant.  The case of a run-time count is
    1858             :            represented using a "zero" ck_init_repeat.  A count of "one" is
    1859             :            strictly speaking superfluous, but it makes it easier to pattern-
    1860             :            match these implicit initializers. */
    1861           0 :         remainder_con = add_repeat_con(remainder_con, count);
    1862           0 :         remainder_con->implicit_aggr_element = TRUE;
    1863           0 :         add_constant_to_aggregate(remainder_con, array_con);
    1864             :       }  /* if */
    1865             :     }  /* if */
    1866             :   }  /* if */
    1867           0 :   if (partial_init_flag) {
    1868             :     /* The missing initializations are not explicit in the initializer.  Set
    1869             :        the partial initializer flag in the initializer state. */
    1870           3 :     is->partial_initializer = TRUE;
    1871           3 :     if (array_con != NULL) {
    1872           3 :       array_con->partial_aggr_value = TRUE;
    1873           3 :       array_con->is_partially_initialized = TRUE;
    1874             :     }  /* if */
    1875             :   }  /* if */
    1876           3 : }  /* aggr_init_array_remainder_if_needed */
    1877             : 
    1878             : 
    1879             : static void set_aggr_tail_not_repeated_flag(a_constant_ptr  repeat_con)
    1880             : /*
    1881             : repeat_con is a ck_init_repeat constant generated for a GNU range designator.
    1882             : The repeated constant is already recorded.  If the repeated constant
    1883             : represents more than one element initializer value, the "repeat" should not
    1884             : apply to any but the first value.  For example:
    1885             :    int x[3][3] = { [0 ... 2][0] = 4, 5, 6 };
    1886             : The constant struct for this is as follows:
    1887             :    <ck_aggregate[3]>
    1888             :      <ck_designator[0]><ck_init_repeat[3]>
    1889             :                          <ck_aggregate[3]>
    1890             :                             <ck_designator[0]> 4
    1891             :                             5
    1892             :                             6
    1893             : Here, the ck_init_repeat should apply only to the first value (4), and not to
    1894             : the "tail" of the ck_aggregate constant it points to.  This is indicated with
    1895             : the multidimensional_aggr_tail_not_repeated flag.  This routine sets that flag
    1896             : to TRUE if needed.
    1897             : */
    1898             : {
    1899             :   a_constant_ptr cp = repeat_con->variant.init_repeat.constant;
    1900             : 
    1901             :   /* Look through any chained designators to see if it was followed by more
    1902             :      than one designated value. */
    1903             :   while (cp != NULL) {
    1904             :     if (cp->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_aggregate &&
    1905             :         !cp->explicit_braces_on_aggregate) {
    1906             :       /* An aggregate constant created by a designator. */
    1907             :       a_constant_ptr  head = cp->variant.aggregate.first_constant;
    1908             :       if (head != NULL && head->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_designator) {
    1909             :         /* A chained designator: It must be followed by at least one element.
    1910             :            If it is followed by more than one, then the repetition doesn't
    1911             :            apply to the subsequent elements. */
    1912             :         check_assertion(head->next != NULL);
    1913             :         if (head->next->next != NULL) {
    1914             :           repeat_con->variant.init_repeat
    1915             :                              .multidimensional_aggr_tail_not_repeated = TRUE;
    1916             :           break;
    1917             :         } else {
    1918             :           /* Examine the designated initializer. */
    1919             :           cp = head->next;
    1920             :         }  /* if */
    1921             :       } else {
    1922             :         cp = head;
    1923             :       }  /* if */
    1924             :     } else if (cp->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_init_repeat) {
    1925             :       /* Another repetition, presumably from a chained array range
    1926             :          designator. */
    1927             :       cp = cp->variant.init_repeat.constant;
    1928             :     } else {
    1929             :       /* Not a constant created by chained designators. */
    1930             :       break;
    1931             :     }  /* if */
    1932             :   }  /* while */
    1933             : }  /* set_aggr_tail_not_repeated_flag */
    1934             : 
    1935             : 
    1936           0 : static void aggr_init_array_designator(an_init_component_ptr  *p_icp,
    1937             :                                        a_type_ptr             atype,
    1938             :                                        an_init_state          *is,
    1939             :                                        a_targ_size_t          *idx,
    1940             :                                        a_constant_ptr         aggr_con,
    1941             :                                        a_source_position      *diag_pos)
    1942             : /*
    1943             : *p_icp points to a designator component encountered while processing a braced
    1944             : initializer for the given array type.  Check if the designator is valid, and,
    1945             : if so, append a matching ck_designator constant to aggr_con.  This routine also
    1946             : consumes initializer components up to and including a non-designator (and
    1947             : *p_icp is updated to point to the component after that, or NULL if there is
    1948             : none).  *is describes the initialization and *idx describes the index of the
    1949             : next element to be initialized (which is updated by this routine).  diag_pos is
    1950             : the position at which to issue diagnostics if no more specific position is
    1951             : available.
    1952             : */
    1953             : {
    1954           0 :   a_boolean              okay, no_bound;
    1955           0 :   an_init_component_ptr  icp = *p_icp;
    1956           0 :   a_targ_size_t          repeat_count = 1;
    1957             : 
    1958           0 :   atype = skip_typerefs(atype);
    1959           0 :   check_assertion(atype->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_array);
    1960           0 :   no_bound = has_unknown_specified_bound(atype) ||
    1961           0 :              (atype->variant.array.variant.number_of_elements == 0 &&
    1962           0 :               !atype->variant.array.bound_is_zero);
    1963           0 :   if (icp->variant.designator.field_name != NULL) {
    1964             :     /* This is not an array designator, but we're in an array initializer.
    1965             :        Issue an error. */
    1966           0 :     okay = FALSE;
    1967           0 :     pos_error(ec_invalid_designator_kind, init_component_pos(icp));
    1968           0 :   } else if (no_bound ||
    1969           0 :              (icp->variant.designator.element_index <
    1970           0 :                             atype->variant.array.variant.number_of_elements &&

    1972             :                             atype->variant.array.variant.number_of_elements)) {
    1973           0 :     okay = TRUE;
    1974           0 :     *idx = icp->variant.designator.element_index;
    1975           0 :     repeat_count = icp->variant.designator.last_element_index - *idx + 1;
    1976             :   } else {
    1977             :     /* The designator indicates a subscript outside the array bounds. */
    1978           0 :     okay = FALSE;
    1979           0 :     pos_error(ec_subscript_out_of_range, init_component_pos(icp));
    1980             :   }  /* if */
    1981           0 :   if (!C_mode() && okay) {
    1982           0 :     a_type_ptr  etype = underlying_array_element_type(atype);
    1983           0 :     etype = skip_typerefs(etype);
    1984           0 :     if (is_immediate_class_type(etype) &&
    1985           0 :         !etype->variant.class_struct_union.is_nonreal_class &&

    1987             :       /* Allowing designators in non-POD types would raise subtle questions
    1988             :          about order of initialization and destruction.  For now, at least,
    1989             :          we disallow such constructs.  (The error is only issued on the first
    1990             :          designator if there is a sequence of consecutive designators.) */
    1991           0 :       pos_error(ec_designator_for_non_POD, init_component_pos(icp));
    1992             :     }  /* if */

    1994           0 :   icp = next_elem(icp);
    1995           0 :   if (okay) {
    1996             :     /* Designators complicate the determination of whether an aggregate
    1997             :        initializer completely covers the target entity.  Assume partial
    1998             :        initialization by default. */
    1999           0 :     is->partial_initializer = TRUE;
    2000           0 :     if (!is->check_validity_only) {
    2001             :       /* Append the array designator constant to the end of the enclosing
    2002             :          aggregate constant. */
    2003           0 :       a_constant_ptr  des_con;
    2004           0 :       des_con = alloc_constant((a_constant_repr_kind)ck_designator);
    2005           0 :       des_con->variant.designator.is_field_designator = FALSE;
    2006           0 :       des_con->variant.designator.variant.array_element = *idx;
    2007           0 :       des_con->source_corresp.decl_position = *init_component_pos(*p_icp);
    2008           0 :       add_constant_to_aggregate(des_con, aggr_con);
    2009           0 :       aggr_con->is_partially_initialized = TRUE;
    2010             :     }  /* if */
    2011           0 :     if (icp != NULL) {
    2012             :       /* Process the component following this designator.  If it is another
    2013             :          designator (i.e., a "chained" designator), special care must be taken
    2014             :          to go down a level in the aggregate structure. */
    2015           0 :       a_constant_ptr     next_con;
    2016           0 :       a_boolean          saved_has_dynamic_init_component = FALSE;
    2017           0 :       a_source_position  *pos = NULL;
    2018           0 :       if (repeat_count > 1) {
    2019             :         /* Temporarily clear the has_dynamic_init_component flag so we can
    2020             :            find out if the designated element has a dynamic component. */
    2021           0 :         saved_has_dynamic_init_component = is->has_dynamic_init_component;
    2022           0 :         is->has_dynamic_init_component = FALSE;
    2023           0 :         pos = init_component_pos(icp);
    2024             :       }  /* if */
    2025           0 :       if (is_designator_component(icp)) {
    2026             :         /* A chained designator follows (e.g., ".x.y =" or ".x[n] ="). */
    2027           0 :         aggr_init_chained_designator(&icp, atype->variant.array.element_type,
    2028             :                                      is, &next_con);
    2029             :       } else {
    2030           0 :         aggr_init_element(&icp, atype->variant.array.element_type, is,
    2031             :                           diag_pos, &next_con);
    2032             :       }  /* if */
    2033           0 :       if (repeat_count > 1) {
    2034             :         /* A repeated initializer cannot have a dynamic component. */
    2035           0 :         if (is->has_dynamic_init_component) {
    2036           0 :           if (is->no_diagnostics) {
    2037           0 :             is->init_error = TRUE;
    2038             :           } else {
    2039           0 :             pos_error(ec_no_range_designator_with_dynamic_init, pos);
    2040             :           }  /* if */
    2041             :         }  /* if */
    2042           0 :         if (saved_has_dynamic_init_component) {
    2043             :           /* If a prior component was dynamic, merge that into the state. */
    2044           0 :           is->has_dynamic_init_component = TRUE;
    2045             :         }  /* if */
    2046             :       }  /* if */
    2047           0 :       *idx += repeat_count;
    2048           0 :       if (next_con != NULL) {
    2049           0 :         check_assertion(!is->check_validity_only);
    2050           0 :         if (repeat_count > 1) {
    2051           0 :           next_con = add_repeat_con(next_con, repeat_count);
    2052           0 :           set_aggr_tail_not_repeated_flag(next_con);
    2053             :         }  /* if */
    2054           0 :         add_constant_to_aggregate(next_con, aggr_con);
    2055             :       }  /* if */
    2056             :     } else {
    2057           0 :       expect_error();
    2058             :     }  /* if */
    2059             :   } else {
    2060             :     /* The designator was invalid.  Subsequent initializer components are
    2061             :        likely not going to match up with the destination type.  So for error
    2062             :        recovery purposes, skip remaining initializer components. */
    2063           0 :     icp = NULL;
    2064           0 :     is->init_error = TRUE;
    2065             :   }  /* if */
    2066           0 :   *p_icp = icp;
    2067           0 : }  /* aggr_init_array_designator */
    2068             : 
    2069             : 
    2070           8 : static void aggr_init_array(an_init_component_ptr  *p_icp,
    2071             :                             a_type_ptr             *p_array_type,
    2072             :                             an_init_state          *is,
    2073             :                             a_source_position      *diag_pos,
    2074             :                             a_constant_ptr         *init_con)
    2075             : /*
    2076             : Produce an aggregate constant (in *init_con) for the initialization of an
    2077             : object or subobject of the array type given by *p_array_type.  The initializer
    2078             : is described by *p_icp, and that value is updated to the next initializer to be
    2079             : considered by the caller (if the initializer is braced, just one initializer is
    2080             : "consumed", but otherwise an arbitrary number may be used for this array
    2081             : initialization).  *is describes the initialization as a whole.
    2082             : */
    2083             : {
    2084           8 :   an_init_component_ptr  icp = *p_icp;
    2085           8 :   a_type_ptr             atype = skip_typerefs(*p_array_type);
    2086             : 
    2087           8 :   check_assertion(atype->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_array);
    2088           8 :   if (try_string_literal_init(icp, p_array_type, is, init_con)) {
    2089             :     /* A string literal initializer.  Nothing more to be done. */
    2090           1 :     *p_icp = next_elem(icp);
    2091           8 :   } else if (is_expression_component(icp) &&
    2092           1 :              try_whole_array_init(icp, atype, init_con)) {
    2093             :     /* Whole-array initialization.  Currently, this is only possible in GNU C
    2094             :        mode with compound literals.  For example:
    2095             :          struct X { int i[3]; } x = { (int[3]){1, 2, 3} };
    2096             :     */
    2097           0 :     *p_icp = next_elem(icp);
    2098             :   } else {
    2099             :     /* Ordinary element-by-element array initialization. */
    2100           7 :     a_targ_size_t  ecount = 0, idx = 0, icount = 0;
    2101           7 :     a_type_ptr     etype = atype->variant.array.element_type;
    2102           7 :     a_boolean      no_bound = FALSE, braced = is_braced_init_component(icp),
    2103           7 :                    zero_sized_element = FALSE, incomplete_array = FALSE,
    2104           7 :                    exploded_string_literal = FALSE;
    2105           7 :     a_boolean      saved_pack_expansion_handled = FALSE;
    2106           7 :     if (is->check_validity_only) {
    2107           0 :       *init_con = NULL;
    2108             :     } else {
    2109           7 :       *init_con = alloc_constant((a_constant_repr_kind)ck_aggregate);
    2110           7 :       (*init_con)->type = atype;
    2111           7 :       (*init_con)->source_corresp.decl_position = *init_component_pos(icp);
    2112             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
    2113           7 :       if (!is_designator_component(icp)) {
    2114           7 :         (*init_con)->end_position = *init_component_end_pos(icp);
    2115             :       }  /* if */
    2116             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
    2117           7 :       (*init_con)->explicit_braces_on_aggregate = braced;
    2118             :     }  /* if */
    2119           7 :     if (braced) {
    2120             :       /* The element values are enclosed in braces. */
    2121             :       /* Diagnostics not associated with a particular element should be issued

    2164             :       no_bound = TRUE;

    2338             : static void set_cli_array_constant_dimensions(an_expr_node_ptr       dim_exprs,
    2339             :                                               a_host_large_unsigned  rank,
    2340             :                                               a_host_large_integer   dims[])

    2362             : 
    2363             : static void aggr_init_cli_array_level(an_init_component_ptr  icp,
    2364             :                                       a_type_ptr             etype,
    2365             :                                       an_init_state          *is,
    2366             :                                       a_host_large_unsigned  rank,
    2367             :                                       a_host_large_integer   dims[],
    2368             :                                       a_boolean              deduce_dims,
    2369             :                                       a_constant_ptr         *result)
    2370             : /*
    2371             : icp is an initializer for a CLI array or a subarray thereof of the given rank.
    2372             : etype is the element type.  is indicates the overall initialization state.
    2373             : dims[rank] is the length of the array if known, or -1 otherwise.  If
    2374             : deduce_dims is TRUE, dims[rank] is updated with the number of elements
    2375             : initialized if that number is larger than the value already recorded in
    2376             : dims[rank].  Produce an aggregate constant representing this initialization in
    2377             : *result.
    2378             : */
    2379             : {
    2380             :   /* Traverse the rank-th dimension of the array. */
    2381             :   if (is_braced_init_component(icp)) {
    2382             :     a_host_large_integer  idx = 0;

    2384             :       a_symbol_ptr  array_type_sym = make_cli_array_type(etype, rank);

    2391             :       }  /* if */

    2393             :       (*result)->explicit_braces_on_aggregate = TRUE;
    2394             :     }  /* if */
    2395             :     icp = icp->variant.braced.list;
    2396             :     while (icp != NULL) {
    2397             :       a_constant_ptr  elem_con;
    2398             :       ++idx;

    2400             :         /* The dimension of this array level is known.  Check for excess
    2401             :            initializers. */
    2402             :         if (idx > dims[rank]) {
    2403             :           /* Too many initializers. */
    2404             :           if (is->no_diagnostics) {
    2405             :             is->init_error = TRUE;
    2406             :           } else {
    2407             :             pos_error(ec_too_many_initializer_values, init_component_pos(icp));
    2408             :           }  /* if */
    2409             :           break;
    2410             :         }  /* if */
    2411             :       }  /* if */
    2412             :       if (rank > 1) {
    2413             :         /* Another CLI array level: Recurse. */
    2414             :         aggr_init_cli_array_level(icp, etype, is, rank-1, dims, deduce_dims,
    2415             :                                   &elem_con);

    2417             :       } else {

    2420             :       }  /* if */

    2422             :         add_constant_to_aggregate(elem_con, *result);
    2423             :       }  /* if */
    2424             :     }  /* for */
    2425             :     if (deduce_dims && idx > dims[rank]) {
    2426             :       /* This is the largest dimension of the given rank we've encountered:
    2427             :          Update the recorded dimension accordingly. */
    2428             :       dims[rank] = idx;
    2429             :     }  /* if */
    2430             :   } else {
    2431             :     if (!is->no_diagnostics && !is->init_error) {
    2432             :       pos_error(ec_exp_lbrace, init_component_pos(icp));
    2433             :     }  /* if */

    2435             :       *result = alloc_error_constant();

    2437             :     is->init_error = TRUE;

    2440             : 
    2441             : 
    2442             : void aggr_init_cli_array(an_init_component_ptr  icp,
    2443             :                          a_type_ptr             hatype,
    2444             :                          an_init_state          *is,
    2445             :                          a_dynamic_init_ptr     *result,
    2446             :                          an_expr_node_ptr       *dim_exprs)
    2447             : /*
    2448             : icp is a brace-enclosed initializer for a handle to CLI array type hatype.
    2449             : *is describes the initialization as a whole.  Produce a dynamic init entry
    2450             : (dik_constant or dik_nonconstant_aggregate) representing the initialization in
    2451             : *result.
    2452             : If *dim_exprs is NULL, deduce the dimensions of the array type from the
    2453             : initializer, and set *dim_exprs to a list of dimension expressions suitable
    2454             : for use in an enk_gcnew node.  (dim_exprs itself must be non-NULL.)
    2455             : */
    2456             : {
    2457             :   a_boolean       unknown_rank = FALSE, saved_elided_braces_disallowed;
    2458             :   a_type_ptr      atype;
    2459             :   a_constant_ptr  aggr_con;
    2460             : 
    2461             :   check_assertion(dim_exprs != NULL);
    2462             :   if (is_handle_type(hatype)) {
    2463             :     /* The normal case: A handle type. */
    2464             :     atype = type_pointed_to(hatype);
    2465             :   } else {
    2466             :     /* Error cases can get here. */
    2467             :     expect_error();
    2468             :     check_assertion(is_error_type(hatype));
    2469             :     atype = hatype;
    2470             :   }  /* if */
    2471             :   /* Microsoft allows brace elision for initializers of CLI arrays with
    2472             :      aggregate element types in all contexts. */
    2473             :   saved_elided_braces_disallowed = is->elided_braces_disallowed;
    2474             :   is->elided_braces_disallowed = FALSE;
    2475             :   /* If the array type is known, work through each level of the array,
    2476             :      and deduce the dimension lengths if needed.  Otherwise, just scan a
    2477             :      generic initializer. */
    2478             :   if (is_cli_array_type(atype)) {
    2479             :     a_type_ptr             etype = cli_array_element_type(atype);

    2481             :     if (!unknown_rank) {
    2482             :       a_host_large_integer   dims[33];
    2483             :       check_assertion(rank >= 1 && rank < 33);
    2484             :       set_cli_array_constant_dimensions(*dim_exprs, rank, dims);
    2485             :       aggr_init_cli_array_level(icp, etype, is, rank, dims, *dim_exprs == NULL,
    2486             :                                 &aggr_con);
    2487             :       if (*dim_exprs == NULL) {
    2488             :         *dim_exprs = make_cli_array_length_nodes(rank, dims);
    2489             :       }  /*if */
    2490             :     } else {
    2491             :       aggr_init_generic_element(icp, atype, is, &aggr_con);
    2492             :     }  /*if */
    2493             :   } else {
    2494             :     /* Presumably a handle to a generic type (that could end up being a CLI
    2495             :        array type). */
    2496             :     check_assertion(is_template_param_or_nonreal_class_type(atype) ||
    2497             :                     is_error_type(atype));
    2498             :     aggr_init_generic_element(icp, atype, is, &aggr_con);
    2499             :   }  /* if */
    2500             :   /* Restore the state wrt. brace elision. */
    2501             :   is->elided_braces_disallowed = saved_elided_braces_disallowed;
    2502             :   /* Wrap the aggregate constant in the appropriate kind of dynamic init
    2503             :      entry. */
    2504             :   *result = alloc_dynamic_init((a_dynamic_init_kind)
    2505             :                    (is->has_dynamic_init_component ? dik_nonconstant_aggregate
    2506             :                                                    : dik_constant));
    2507             :   (*result)->variant.constant = aggr_con;
    2508             :   (*result)->is_braced_initializer = TRUE;
    2509             : }  /* aggr_init_cli_array */
    2510             : 
    2511             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    2512             : 
    2513             : 
    2514           0 : static a_boolean try_whole_aggr_class_init(an_init_component_ptr  *p_icp,
    2515             :                                            a_type_ptr             class_type,
    2516             :                                            an_init_state          *is,
    2517             :                                            a_constant_ptr         *result)
    2518             : /*
    2519             : p_icp represents an expression that might initialize an aggregate class of the
    2520             : given type (the whole class object; not just a field of it).  If it does,
    2521             : return TRUE, set *result to the a_constant entry representing the initializer,
    2522             : and update *p_icp to the next component that hasn't been consumed.
    2523             : For example:
    2524             :          struct S { int i; } s, as[]{ 1, s };
    2525             : Here the component 1 does not wholly initialize an element of as (so FALSE is
    2526             : returned with no further action), but the component s does (so this function
    2527             : returns TRUE, and sets *result to a constant representing the dynamic
    2528             : initialization of as[1]).
    2529             : */
    2530             : {
    2531           0 :   a_boolean  success = FALSE;
    2532             : 
    2533           0 :   check_assertion(is_expression_component(*p_icp));
    2534           0 :   if (whole_aggr_class_init_possible(*p_icp, class_type)) {
    2535           0 :     aggr_init_simple_element(p_icp, class_type, is, result);
    2536           0 :     success = TRUE;
    2537             :   }  /* if */
    2538           0 :   return success;
    2539             : }  /* try_whole_aggr_class_init */
    2540             : 
    2541             : 
    2542             : static a_boolean has_initializable_subobject(a_type_ptr  class_type)
    2543             : /*
    2544             : Return TRUE if the given class type has an initializable field or base.

    2561             : 
    2562           0 : static void aggr_init_class_remainder_if_needed(a_constant_ptr     aggr_con,
    2563             :                                                 a_type_ptr         aggr_type,
    2564             :                                                 a_field_ptr        next_field,
    2565             :                                                 a_base_class_ptr   next_bcp,
    2566             :                                                 an_init_state      *is,
    2567             :                                                 a_source_position  *diag_pos)
    2568             : /*
    2569             : We have processed an aggregate initializer for the given type, but it does not
    2570             : explicitly initialize all its subobjects.  The first uninitialized subobject
    2571             : is either the base class next_bcp, or, if that is NULL, the field next_field.
    2572             : Append any needed constants to the list embedded in aggr_con if the
    2573             : no_diagnostics flag is FALSE (if it is TRUE, aggr_con will be NULL).
    2574             : *is describes the initialization as a whole, and diag_pos indicates the
    2575             : position for which diagnostics should be issued.
    2576             : */

    2578           0 :   a_field_ptr           fp, last_dyn_field = NULL;

    2582             : 
    2583             :   /* Register aggr_con as currently being initialized, in case a member
    2584             :      initializer refers to a previously-initialized member.  That is
    2585             :      represented by a member access expression using an enk_param_ref node

    2588           0 :   push_aggr_init_constant(aggr_con, &aggr_init_con);

    2784             : static a_boolean check_flexible_array_init(an_init_component_ptr  icp,
    2785             :                                            a_field_ptr            fp,
    2786             :                                            an_init_state          *is)
    2787             : /*
    2788             : icp is an aggregate initializer component for a flexible array member fp in an
    2789             : initialization described by *is.  Check if that situation is valid; if not,
    2790             : issue an error or set is->init_error to TRUE (depending on other flags in *is),
    2791             : and return FALSE.  Otherwise, return TRUE.
    2792             : */
    2793             : {
    2794             :   a_boolean  result = TRUE;
    2795             : 
    2796             :   if (gnu_mode && is_braced_init_component(icp) &&
    2797             :       icp->variant.braced.list == NULL) {
    2798             :     /* GCC appears to always permit a "{}" initializer for a flexible array
    2799             :        member. */
    2800             :   } else if (microsoft_mode || (gcc_mode && is->static_lifetime_init)) {
    2801             :     a_type_ptr  etype = underlying_array_element_type(fp->type);
    2802             :     etype = skip_typerefs(etype);
    2803             :     if (!C_mode() && is_immediate_class_type(etype)) {
    2804             :       a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr  cssp = symbol_supplement_for_class(etype);
    2805             :       if (has_nontrivial_destructor(cssp)) {
    2806             :         /* Microsoft C++ allows the aggregate initialization of flexible array
    2807             :            members only if they do not have nontrivial destructors. */
    2808             :         result = FALSE;
    2809             :         if (is->no_diagnostics) {
    2810             :           is->init_error = TRUE;
    2811             :         } else {
    2812             :           pos_error(ec_cannot_initialize_destructible_flexible_array,
    2813             :                     init_component_pos(icp));
    2814             :         }  /* if */
    2815             :       }  /* if */
    2816             :     } else if (gcc_mode && is->non_top_level_aggregate) {
    2817             :       /* GCC does not allow flexible array member initializers that are not at
    2818             :          the top level, except if the initializer is empty (handled above).
    2819             :          For example:
    2820             :            struct F { int n; int a[]; };
    2821             :            struct T { struct F f; };
    2822             :            T x1 = { { 1, {} } };     // Okay: non-top-level but empty.
    2823             :            T x2 = { { 1, { 2 } } };  // Error.
    2824             :       */
    2825             :       result = FALSE;
    2826             :       if (is->no_diagnostics) {
    2827             :         is->init_error = TRUE;

    2830             :                   init_component_pos(icp));
    2831             :       }  /* if */
    2832             :     }  /* if */
    2833             :   } else {
    2834             :     result = FALSE;
    2835             :     if (is->no_diagnostics) {
    2836             :       is->init_error = TRUE;

    2838             :       pos_error(gcc_mode ? ec_cannot_init_auto_flexible_array_member
    2839             :                          : ec_cannot_initialize_flexible_array_member,

    2842             :   }  /* if */

    2851             :     }  /* if */
    2852             :   }  /* if */
    2853             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED || GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    2854             :   return result;

    2857             : 
    2858         135 : static void aggr_init_field(an_init_component_ptr  *p_icp,
    2859             :                             a_field_ptr            *p_field,
    2860             :                             an_init_state          *is,
    2861             :                             a_constant_ptr         aggr_con,
    2862             :                             a_source_position      *diag_pos)
    2863             : /*
    2864             : *p_icp is non-NULL and describes an initializer for *p_field (also non-NULL).
    2865             : Append a constant representing this initializer to the given aggregate constant
    2866             : (aggr_con).  *is tracks state information for the complete initializer and
    2867             : diag_pos is the position to use for diagnostics by default (if no more specific
    2868             : position is available).
    2869             : */
    2870             : {
    2871         135 :   a_field_ptr            fp = *p_field;
    2872         135 :   a_type_ptr             class_type = parent_class_of(fp), dtype = fp->type;
    2873         135 :   a_boolean              ms_enum_bit_field = FALSE;
    2874         135 :   an_init_component_ptr  icp = *p_icp;
    2875         135 :   a_constant_ptr         elem_con;
    2876             : 
    2877         135 :   if (is->pack_expansion_handled) {
    2878             :     /* If a pack expansion has been seen, we cannot match up types anymore.
    2879             :        Change the destination type to "the unknown type". */
    2880           0 :     dtype = type_of_unknown_templ_param_nontype;
    2881             :   } else if (fp->is_bit_field) {
    2882             :     if (mscpp_version_is(any_version) && is_enum_type(dtype)) {
    2883             :       /* Microsoft's C++ compiler allow bit fields of enumeration types to be
    2884             :          initialized by integer values.  We emulate this by converting to the
    2885             :          underlying integer type, and then converting the result back to the
    2886             :          enumeration type. */
    2887             :       dtype = integer_type(skip_typerefs(dtype)->variant.integer.int_kind);
    2888             :       ms_enum_bit_field = TRUE;
    2889             :     }  /* if */
    2890             :   }  /* if */
    2891         180 :   if ((fp->next == NULL || class_type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_union) &&

    2893           0 :     if (!check_flexible_array_init(icp, fp, is)) {
    2894             :       /* An invalid attempt to initialize a flexible array.  Make sure that we
    2895             :          move to the next initializer component (to avoid an infinite loop).
    2896             :          Either is->init_error has been set, or an error message has been
    2897             :          issued.  For error recovery purposes, end the traversal of initializer
    2898             :          components at this point (additional elements are most likely to
    2899             :          trigger additional, unhelpful errors). */
    2900           0 :       check_assertion_or_expect_error(is->init_error);

    2910             :     }  /* if */
    2911             :   } else {
    2912         135 :     aggr_init_element_full(p_icp, dtype, fp, is, diag_pos, &elem_con);
    2913             :   }  /* if */
    2914         135 :   if (ms_enum_bit_field) {
    2915             :     /* A Microsoft enum bit field being initialized with an integer.
    2916             :        Implicitly cast the result back to the enumeration type.
    2917             :        (We use type_change_constant_full for the constant and add_cast for the
    2918             :        non-constant case.) */
    2919             :     if (elem_con->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_dynamic_init) {
    2920             :       a_dynamic_init_ptr  dip = elem_con->variant.dynamic_init;

    2923             :       elem_con->type = dip->variant.expression->type;

    2925             :       a_boolean  did_not_fold = FALSE;
    2926             :       type_change_constant_full(elem_con, fp->type,

    2928             :                                 /*constant_context=*/FALSE,
    2929             :                                 /*evaluated_context=*/TRUE,
    2930             :                                 /*fold_constant_addr_exprs=*/FALSE,

    2941         135 :   if (!is->check_validity_only && elem_con != NULL) {
    2942         135 :     add_constant_to_aggregate(elem_con, aggr_con);
    2943             :   }  /* if */
    2944         135 :   if (class_type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_union) {
    2945             :     /* In the case of a union, only one field is usually initialized.
    2946             :        (Designated initializers can override that.) */
    2947           0 :     *p_field = NULL;

    2949         135 :     *p_field = next_proper_initializable_field(fp->next);

    2954           0 : static void aggr_init_field_designator(an_init_component_ptr  *p_icp,

    2958             :                                        a_constant_ptr         aggr_con,
    2959             :                                        a_source_position      *diag_pos)
    2960             : /*

    3180          45 : static void aggr_init_class(an_init_component_ptr  *p_icp,

    3379           0 : static void aggr_init_chained_designator(an_init_component_ptr  *p_icp,
    3380             :                                          a_type_ptr             aggr_type,
    3381             :                                          an_init_state          *is,
    3382             :                                          a_constant_ptr         *result)
    3383             : /*
    3384             : *p_icp represents a "chained" designator; i.e., a designator immediately
    3385             : following another designator.  For example, ".i" and "[3]" in ".x.i[3]".
    3386             : aggr_type is the type into which the designator refers.  Call aggr_init_class
    3387             : or aggr_init_array at the level that the designator applies to, or issue a
    3388             : diagnostic if aggr_type is not a type in which designators can be used.  The
    3389             : designated constant, if any, is produced in *result and *p_icp is updated to
    3390             : point to the component following the designated component (or NULL if no more
    3391             : components follow at the current level).

    3407             :                     result);

    3414           0 :   } else if (is_template_param_type(aggr_type)) {
    3415             :     /* We cannot represent designators in nonreal types.  This was diagnosed

    3417           0 :     unexpected_condition();

    3432        1784 : static void check_address_constant_init(a_constant_ptr     constant,

    3437             : /*
    3438             : The given constant initializes an entity of type dtype.  (In the case of a
    3439             : field, fp points to its representation; otherwise, fp is NULL.)  Check that

    3465           0 : static void aggr_init_aggregate_class_with_nontrivial_default_ctor(
    3466             :                                    an_init_component_ptr  icp,

    3468             :                                    an_init_state          *is,
    3469             :                                    a_source_position      *diag_pos,
    3470             :                                    a_constant_ptr         *init_con)
    3471             : /*
    3472             : Create in *init_con a dynamic aggregate initializer for an element of an
    3473             : aggregate class type etype that has a nontrivial default constructor.  icp is
    3474             : the explicit or implicit aggregate initializer and always represents empty
    3475             : braces.  *is tracks the initialization state.  diag_pos is the position to use
    3476             : for diagnostics.
    3477             : 
    3478             : Although the resulting initializer invokes a constructor, its semantics must
    3479             : be equivalent to those of aggregate initialization with "{}".  In C++14 this
    3480             : means that the regular default constructor might not be usable (it could be
    3481             : deleted): In such cases an "internal constructor" is created for this
    3482             : particular situation.

    3485           0 :   a_routine_ptr       rp, ctor = NULL, dtor;

    3606         191 : static void aggr_init_element_full(an_init_component_ptr  *p_icp,
    3607             :                                    a_type_ptr             etype,
    3608             :                                    a_field_ptr            field,
    3609             :                                    an_init_state          *is,
    3610             :                                    a_source_position      *diag_pos,
    3611             :                                    a_constant_ptr         *init_con)
    3612             : /*
    3613             : Handle the initialization of an element of type etype of an aggregate by the
    3614             : component *p_icp (and potentially, the components that follow *p_icp); return
    3615             : in *p_icp the next item not used for this initialization (NULL if there are no
    3616             : more such items).  If this is the initialization of a field, the given field
    3617             : pointer will point to its representation; otherwise, it will be NULL.  Return
    3618             : the result in *init_con.  *is describes the initialization as a whole, and
    3619             : diag_pos indicates the position at which diagnostics should be issued if no
    3620             : more specific position is available.  If this element is itself an aggregate,
    3621             : then this routine recurses into aggr_init_array or aggr_init_class, to produce
    3622             : a ck_aggregate constant.
    3623             : 
    3624             : (This routine is usually called through the macro aggr_init_element.)
    3625             : */

    3627         191 :   an_init_component_ptr  icp = *p_icp;

    3737             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
    3738             :     }  /* if */
    3739             :     *p_icp = next_elem(icp);
    3740             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    3741             :   } else {
    3742             :     /* Use the single value in *p_icp to initialize one element. */
    3743         145 :     aggr_init_simple_element(p_icp, etype, is, init_con);
    3744         145 :     if (*init_con != NULL) {
    3745         145 :       check_address_constant_init(*init_con, etype, field, is,
    3746             :                                   init_component_pos(icp));

    3756             : 
    3757             : 
    3758         964 : static void prep_initializer_result(an_init_state  *is,
    3759             :                                     a_routine_ptr  dtor_rp)
    3760             : /*
    3761             : The given init state describes an initializer that has been processed: It is
    3762             : either an error state, or it points to a constant or dynamic init entry.
    3763             : dtor_rp is the destructor needed to destroy the initializer value (or NULL if
    3764             : none is needed).
    3765             : Ensure that is->init_con or is_init_dip is non-NULL as appropriate given *is
    3766             : and dtor_rp.  In particular, create a dynamic init entry for the initialization
    3767             : if any of the flags is->has_dynamic_init_component or is->force_dynamic_init
    3768             : are TRUE.
    3769             : */
    3770             : {
    3771         964 :   if (is->init_dip == NULL) {

    3774           0 :       check_assertion(is->init_error);

    3779           0 :         is->init_con->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_aggregate) {
    3780           0 :       dik = (a_dynamic_init_kind)dik_nonconstant_aggregate;
    3781             :     }  /* if */

    3783          10 :       is->init_dip = alloc_dynamic_init(dik);
