    3794             : 
    3795          10 : void prep_aggr_initializer(an_init_component_ptr        icp,
    3796             :                            a_type_ptr                   *p_type,
    3797             :                            an_init_state                *is,
    3798             :                            struct an_arg_match_summary  *arg_match,
    3799             :                            a_boolean                    fill_in_dtor)
    3800             : /*
    3801             : Convert an initializer value represented by icp to the aggregate type *p_type
    3802             : of the entity being initialized.  The result is returned through *is (in
    3803             : particular, is->init_con and is->init_dip).  If fill_in_dtor is TRUE a
    3804             : destructor will be added to the dynamic initialization if one is needed, but
    3805             : the dynamic init will not be placed on any object lifetime list (the caller
    3806             : must do that).  If the entity being initialized is an unknown-bound array,
    3807             : *p_type will be updated to the complete array type matching the number of
    3808             : elements initialized.  arg_match points to a structure used by expression
    3809             : processing to track the worst argument match during overload resolution;
    3810             : the type pointed to is opaque to declaration processing.
    3811             : */
    3812             : {
    3813          10 :   a_source_position_ptr  diag_pos = init_component_pos(icp);
    3814          10 :   a_routine_ptr          dtor_rp = NULL;

    3816          10 :   a_boolean              saved_force_dynamic_init = is->force_dynamic_init;
    3817          10 :   a_boolean              unknown_bound_array;
    3818          10 :   struct an_arg_match_summary
    3819          10 :                          *saved_arg_match = is->arg_match;
    3820             : 
    3821          10 :   is->arg_match = arg_match;
    3822          10 :   check_assertion(!C_mode());
    3823          10 :   is->init_con = NULL;
    3824          10 :   is->init_dip = NULL;
    3825             :   /* The force_dynamic_init flag only applies to the top-level result. */
    3826          10 :   is->force_dynamic_init = FALSE;
    3827             :   /* C++11 requires a diagnostic on narrowing in these cases, but in nonstrict
    3828             :      modes we only make it a warning to permit the conversions traditionally
    3829             :      allowed in C-style aggregate initializations.  That also matches the
    3830             :      behavior of newer versions of GCC. */

    3832           0 :     is->error_on_narrowing = TRUE;
    3833             :   } else {
    3834          10 :     is->warning_on_narrowing = TRUE;

    3947           0 : static void process_simple_init_component(an_init_component_ptr  icp,
    3948             :                                           a_type_ptr             dtype,

    3951             : /*

    4017             :     append_elem(icp, icp2);

    4023             : 
    4024             : 
    4025           7 : static void braced_initializer(a_type_ptr          dtype,
    4026             :                                an_init_component   *rescan_aggr,
    4027             :                                an_init_state       *is,
    4028             :                                a_decl_parse_state  *dps,
    4029             :                                a_boolean           fill_in_dtor,
    4030             :                                an_init_component   **return_icp,
    4031             :                                a_source_position   *diag_pos)
    4032             : /*
    4033             : Handle a braced-init-list following a declarator, a mem-initializer-id, or a
    4034             : new-type-id, as well as the braced construct in a C99-style compound literal.
    4035             : If the direct_init flag in the initialization state is TRUE, the initializer
    4036             : uses direct initialization syntax (e.g., "T x{3};"); otherwise, it uses copy
    4037             : initialization syntax (e.g., "T x = {3};").
    4038             : dtype is the type of the entity being initialized.  *is describes the state of
    4039             : initializer processing.  *dps describes the declaration that the initializer
    4040             : is part of; it is NULL if the initialization is not (directly) part of a
    4041             : declaration.  diag_pos is the position to be used by default for diagnostics.  
    4042             : If return_icp is non-NULL, return the init-component entry for the
    4043             : braced-init-list in *return_icp instead of freeing it as usual.  If
    4044             : rescan_aggr is non-NULL, a rescan is being done during template
    4045             : deduction; rescan_aggr provides a braced-init-list for the
    4046             : initializer, already copied and substituted.
    4047             : */
    4048             : {
    4049           7 :   an_init_component_ptr  icp_tree, icp;
    4050           7 :   a_boolean              is_aggregate = FALSE, is_var_init;
    4051           7 :   a_boolean              saved_force_dynamic_init = is->force_dynamic_init;
    4052           7 :   a_boolean              saved_no_diagnostics = is->no_diagnostics;
    4053           7 :   a_routine_ptr          dtor_rp = NULL;
    4054           7 :   a_boolean              need_to_free_icp_tree = FALSE;
    4055           7 :   a_boolean              saved_reduce_backing_expression_use;

    4087             :        braced initializer of the form "{ <initializer> ... }" without regard

    4089             :        represented in the IL).  For example:
    4090             :            struct S {
    4091             :              int x;
    4092             :              template<typename ... Ts> S(Ts &...ps): x{ps...} {}
    4093             :                // Even though x is a known "int" in this context, proceed
    4094             :                // as if it were an unknown type (and produce a ck_aggregate
    4095             :                // constant initializer since it can represent a pack
    4096             :                // expansion).

    4099           0 :     dtype = type_of_unknown_templ_param_nontype;

    4101           7 :   switch (dtype->kind) {
    4102           0 :     case tk_error:
    4103             :     case tk_template_param:
    4104             :       /* Unknown destination type: Create an aggregate constant that follows
    4105             :          the source form. */
    4106           0 :       is_aggregate = TRUE;
    4107           0 :       aggr_init_generic_element(icp, dtype, is, &is->init_con);
    4108           0 :       break;

    4114             :            must be copied (this is unusual for built-in arrays). */

    4133             :           }  /* if */
    4134             :         }  /* if */
    4135             :       }  /* if */
    4136             :       break;
    4137             : #if GNU_VECTOR_TYPES_ALLOWED
    4138           0 :     case tk_vector:
    4139             :       /* A GNU vector type. */
    4140           0 :       is_aggregate = TRUE;

    4273           7 : static void brace_init_variable(a_decl_parse_state  *dps,

    4278             : /*

    4280             : data member.  If direct is TRUE, the initializer uses direct initialization
    4281             : syntax (e.g., "T x{3};"); otherwise, it uses copy initialization syntax (e.g.,

    4361         947 : static void expr_direct_init_object(a_decl_parse_state  *dps,
    4362             :                                     an_id_linkage_kind  linkage,

    4365             : /*
    4366             : Scan and process the expression in a parenthesized variable or member
    4367             : initializer (both are "direct" initializers) where the initialization is not
    4368             : via a constructor (e.g., The expression "4" in "int x(4);" or in
    4369             : "struct S { S(): x(4) {} int x; };").  dps is the declaration parsing state

    4674           0 : void scan_compound_literal_initializer(a_decl_parse_state  *dps,
    4675             :                                        an_init_component  *rescan_aggr,
    4676             :                                        an_init_component  **return_icp)
    4677             : /*
    4678             : Scan the brace-enclosed part of a compound literal.  Such literals are of the
    4679             : form (type){initializer} or (type){initializer,}.  The type provided in
    4680             : parentheses is passed to this function through dps->type; if this type is
    4681             : incomplete, the complete type should be deduced from the initializer and
    4682             : dps->type will be updated with that complete type.  The caller also sets the
    4683             : dps->init_state.static_lifetime_init flag depending on the context of the
    4684             : expression containing the compound literal.  A dynamic init entry is
    4685             : created by this function and a pointer to it is returned through
    4686             : dps->init_state.init_dip.  If return_icp is non-NULL, return the init-component
    4687             : entry for the braced-init-list in *return_icp instead of freeing it as usual.
    4688             : The caller is responsible for ensuring that the current token is a brace, and
    4689             : the function braced_initializer does all the hard work.  If rescan_aggr is
    4690             : non-NULL, a rescan is being done during template deduction; rescan_aggr
    4691             : provides a braced-init-list for the initializer, already copied and
    4692             : substituted.
    4693             : */

    4738        5521 : void initializer(a_decl_parse_state  *dps,
    4739             :                  a_source_position   *source_pos,

    4745             : Scan an initializer for the declaration described by *dps (dps->sym points
    4746             : to an sk_variable or sk_static_data_member symbol).  The linkage of the
    4747             : initialized entity is given by linkage.  *source_pos is the declaration's
    4748             : position for diagnostic purposes.
    4749             : The C-mode syntax is:
    4750             : 
    4751             : 3.5.7  initializer:
    4752             :                 assignment-expression
    4753             :                 { initializer-list }
    4754             :                 { initializer-list , }
    4755             : 
    4756             :        initializer-list:
    4757             :                 initializer-list
    4758             :                 initializer-list , initializer
    4759             : 
    4760             : In C mode parenthesized_initializer is always FALSE, but in C++ mode it can
    4761             : be TRUE to indicate an alternate syntax (ARM 8.4):
    4762             : 
    4763             :        initializer:
    4764             :                 ( expression-list )
    4765             : 
    4766             : Note: when parenthesized_initializer is TRUE, the current token is the token
    4767             : immediately following the left parenthesis; on return, the closing right
    4768             : parenthesis will have been swallowed.  If the caller should suppress issuing
    4769             : an error on an incomplete type, *incomplete_type_error_reported will be
    4770             : returned set to TRUE.

    5719         214 : a_token_cache_ptr cache_inclass_initializer(a_symbol_ptr  sym)
    5720             : /*
    5721             : Cache the tokens that make up an in-class initializer for the static data
    5722             : member, nonstatic data member, or variable template specified by sym.
    5723             : Return a pointer to the token cache that was created.  This used for
    5724             : C++11-style field initializers, but also for C++14 variable templates,
    5725             : static data members of class templates in GNU C++ mode, and static data
    5726             : members of managed class types in some Microsoft modes.
    5727             : */
    5728             : {
    5729         214 :   a_token_cache_ptr        token_cache = alloc_token_cache();
    5730         214 :   a_token_sequence_number  first_tsn;
    5731         214 :   a_token_sequence_number  last_tsn;
    5732         214 :   a_token_sequence_number  last_tsn_for_cache;
    5733         214 :   a_token_set_array        stop_tokens;

    5736         214 :   a_boolean                is_var_templ = symbol_is(sym, sk_variable_template);

    5740             : 
    5741             :   /* Determine the class that is being defined. */

    5836           0 : void init_capture_initializer(a_lambda_capture    *lcp,
    5837             :                               a_decl_parse_state  *dps)
    5838             : /*
    5839             : Process the initializer for the given C++14-style init-capture (*lcp) whose
    5840             : associated initialization (and field declaration) is described by *dps.  That

    5842             : field (of a closure type), it is different from a C++11 field initializer in
    5843             : that it not treated as a full expression (or a braced list of full expressions)
    5844             : and not pointed to by the field (because it may be stored in function-scope

    5916             : 
    5917           8 : void repeat_nonconstant_init(a_dynamic_init_ptr  ctor_dip,
    5918             :                              a_type_ptr          array_type,

    5920             :                              a_dynamic_init_ptr  new_dip,
    5921             :                              a_targ_size_t       count)
    5922             : /*
    5923             : Define a dynamic init entry for a nonconstant aggregate, which will always be
    5924             : for an array (of type array_type) whose elements (of type elem_type) are to
    5925             : be initialized by a series of constructor calls.  The dynamic entry to be
    5926             : defined (new_dip) has already been allocated; the dynamic init entry that
    5927             : represents the constructor call is ctor_dip.  count is the number of
    5928             : elements in the array to be initialized.  Note that multi-dimensional
    5929             : arrays are treated as one-dimensional arrays.

    5938             :              constant (ck_dynamic_init) ->
    5939             :                original dynamic init ctor_dip (dik_constructor)
    5940             :   */

    5955             : 
    5956             : 
    5957        1553 : a_boolean def_initializer(a_symbol_ptr       sym,
    5958             :                           a_source_position  *err_pos)
    5959             : /*
    5960             : Perform default initialization for variables and static data members of class
    5961             : type if needed.  Such initialization is required whenever the class has a
    5962             : constructor; the default constructor (if one exists) is called.  Return TRUE
    5963             : if the default initialization of a class type object is performed
    5964             : (conceptually; in some class type cases TRUE may be returned without an actual
    5965             : call to a constructor, and in template cases TRUE may be returned when the
    5966             : object is not known to be of class type).  No initialization is performed (and
    5967             : FALSE is returned) for non-class objects.
    5968             : */

    5970        1553 :   a_boolean                         def_init_performed = FALSE;

    6105             :              constructor will be called.  We apply the as-if rule and suppress

    6115         306 :       dtor = select_destructor(tp, tp, err_pos);

    6488             :

    6490         687 : static void free_mem_init_args_cache(a_mem_init_args_cache_ptr  cache)

    6504             : /*
    6505             : Data structure describing the state of the constructor init list associated
    6506             : with a constructor being defined.
    6507             : */
    6508             : typedef struct a_ctor_init_block {
    6509             :   a_constructor_init_ptr
    6510             :                 cip_list, end_of_cip_list;

    6512             :                            recorded for a constructor.  (NULL if none.) */
    6513             :   a_constructor_init_ptr
    6514             :                 direct_list, end_of_direct_list;
    6515             :                         /* Pointers to the first and last constructor inits
    6516             :                            for direct base classes recorded for a constructor.
    6517             :                            (NULL if there are no such base classes.) */
    6518             :   a_constructor_init_ptr
    6519             :                 virtual_list, end_of_virtual_list;
    6520             :                         /* Pointer to the first constructor init for a virtual
    6521             :                            base class. */
    6522             :   a_pack_expansion_stack_entry_ptr
    6523             :                 pesep;
    6524             :                         /* If pack_expansion_context_started is TRUE, the pack
    6525             :                            expansion stack entry produced by the associated
    6526             :                            call to begin_potential_pack_expansion_context. */
    6527             :   a_mem_init_args_cache_ptr
    6528             :                 pending_mem_init_cache;
    6529             :                         /* If we're caching an explicit mem-initializer, a
    6530             :                            pointer to an entry describing that cache. */
    6531             :   a_constructor_init_ptr
    6532             :                 last_order_checked_init;
    6533             :                         /* Pointer to last constructor init entry for a
    6534             :                            mem-initializer whose order has been checked against
    6535             :                            the declaration order of bases and members. */
    6536             :   a_type_ptr    pending_decltype_initializer_type;
    6537             :                         /* A decltype-specifier in a mem-initializer-id can
    6538             :                            be either a delegating constructor or a base
    6539             :                            class initializer, for example:
    6540             :                                struct B {};
    6541             :                                struct A : B {
    6542             :                                  A() {}
    6543             :                                  A(int) : decltype(A())() {}
    6544             :                                  A(float) : decltype(B())() {}
    6545             :                                };
    6546             :                            decltype-specifiers in a mem-initializer-id are
    6547             :                            consumed by delegating_ctor_initializer, and if
    6548             :                            found not to be a delegating constructor, the
    6549             :                            resulting type is stored here for later
    6550             :                            consideration as a base class initializer. */
    6551             :   a_source_position
    6552             :                 pending_decltype_pos;
    6553             :                         /* When pending_decltype_initializer_type is non-NULL,
    6554             :                            contains the starting source position of the
    6555             :                            decltype-specifier. */
    6556             :   a_boolean     has_explicit_init;
    6557             :                         /* TRUE if mem-initializers appear explicitly in the
    6558             :                            source code of this constructor, but possibly FALSE
    6559             :                            if an empty pack expansion results in there not
    6560             :                            being any actual explicit mem-initializers. */
    6561             :   a_boolean     out_of_order_diag_issued;
    6562             :                         /* TRUE if a diagnostic has been issued about
    6563             :                            mem-initializers not matching declaration order. */
    6564             :   a_boolean     pack_expansion_context_started;
    6565             :                         /* TRUE if begin_potential_pack_expansion_context has
    6566             :                            been called for a mem-initializer, and elements
    6567             :                            remain to be processed for that call. */
    6568             : } a_ctor_init_block;
    6569             : 
    6570             : /*
    6571             : Macro that returns TRUE when a decltype-specifier is allowed in a
    6572             : mem-initializer and the token stream indicates that such a decltype
    6573             : is present at the current spot (either because curr_token ==
    6574             : tok_decltype_construct or because a previously scanned decltype-specifier
    6575             : is pending).
    6576             : */
    6577             : #define is_decltype_mem_initializer(cibp)                                     \
    6578             :   (enable_decltype_in_base_specifier_and_mem_initializer &&                   \
    6579             :    (curr_token == tok_decltype_construct ||                                   \
    6580             :     (cibp)->pending_decltype_initializer_type != NULL))                       \
    6581             : 
    6582             : 
    6583             : static void begin_cache_mem_initializer(a_ctor_init_block  *cibp)
    6584             : /*
    6585             : Start a cache entry for a mem-initializer and point to it from cibp.
    6586             : */
    6587             : {
    6588             :   a_mem_init_args_cache_ptr  cache = alloc_mem_init_args_cache();
    6589             : 
    6590             :   cache->start_tsn = curr_token_sequence_number;
    6591             :   clear_token_cache(&cache->tokens, /*reusable=*/TRUE);
    6592             :   begin_caching_fetched_tokens(/*include_curr_token=*/TRUE);
    6593             :   cibp->pending_mem_init_cache = cache;
    6594             : }  /* begin_cache_mem_initializer */
    6595             : 
    6596             : 
    6597             : static void end_cache_mem_initializer(a_ctor_init_block  *cibp)
    6598             : /*
    6599             : Complete the caching of a mem-initializer.  This involves suspending
    6600             : background token caching and copying the tokens cached during that process to
    6601             : the active mem-initializer token cache.
    6602             : */
    6603             : {
    6604             :   a_mem_init_args_cache_ptr  cache = cibp->pending_mem_init_cache;
    6605             :   a_token_sequence_number    last_tsn;
    6606             :   a_boolean                  include_last_token = FALSE;
    6607             : 
    6608             :   if (curr_token == tok_ellipsis) (void)get_token();
    6609             :   end_caching_fetched_tokens();
    6610             :   last_tsn = curr_token_sequence_number;
    6611             :   if (curr_token == tok_end_of_source) {
    6612             :     /* There was no token beyond the last mem-initializer token.  So last_tsn
    6613             :        is the last token number of the mem-initializer proper and not that of
    6614             :        the next token. */
    6615             :     include_last_token = TRUE;
    6616             :   }  /* if */
    6617             :   copy_tokens_from_cache(curr_lexical_state_cache(), cache->start_tsn,
    6618             :                          last_tsn, include_last_token, &cache->tokens);
    6619             :   adjust_token_handles(&cache->tokens);
    6620             :   terminate_token_cache(&cache->tokens);
    6621             :   cibp->pending_mem_init_cache = NULL;
    6622             : }  /* end_cache_mem_initializer */
    6623             : 
    6624             : 
    6625             : static void abort_cache_mem_initializer(a_ctor_init_block  *cibp)
    6626             : /*
    6627             : Stop the caching of the current mem-initializer tokens and discard the
    6628             : associated structures.
    6629             : */
    6630             : {
    6631             :   end_caching_fetched_tokens();
    6632             :   free_mem_init_args_cache(cibp->pending_mem_init_cache);
    6633             :   cibp->pending_mem_init_cache = NULL;
    6634             : }  /* abort_cache_mem_initializer */
    6635             : 
    6636             : 
    6637             : static void check_out_of_order_init(a_constructor_init_ptr  new_cip,
    6638             :                                     a_ctor_init_block       *cibp)
    6639             : /*
    6640             : new_cip represents a new constructor initializer and *cibp tracks the state of
    6641             : constructor initializers for that same construct definition.  If it hasn't
    6642             : been done yet, issue a remark if the new initializer will occur before the
    6643             : previous initializer and update the state for the new entry.
    6644             : */
    6645             : {
    6646             :   if (!cibp->out_of_order_diag_issued) {
    6647             :     a_boolean  is_out_of_order = FALSE;
    6648             :     if (cibp->last_order_checked_init == NULL) {
    6649             :       /* There was no previous initializer, so there cannot be an out-of-order
    6650             :          item yet. */
    6651             :     } else if (new_cip->kind < cibp->last_order_checked_init->kind) {
    6652             :       /* The previous item was of a kind that is initialized after the current
    6653             :          item. */
    6654             :       is_out_of_order = TRUE;
    6655             :     } else if (new_cip->kind == cibp->last_order_checked_init->kind) {
    6656             :       /* The previous item was of the same kind as the current item, so they
    6657             :          should both be on the same list.  See if the new item comes after it
    6658             :          on the initialization-order list (which would mean the order of the
    6659             :          two initializers matches the order in which the corresponding
    6660             :          initializations are done). */
    6661             :       a_constructor_init_ptr  cip = cibp->last_order_checked_init;
    6662             :       for (; cip != NULL; cip = cip->next) {
    6663             :         if (cip == new_cip) break;
    6664             :       }  /* if */
    6665             :       /* If new_cip was not found after the last checked entry, presumably it
    6666             :          came before it, and an out-of-order diagnostic should be issued. */
    6667             :       is_out_of_order = (cip == NULL);
    6668             :     }  /* if */
    6669             :     if (is_out_of_order) {
    6670             :       pos_sy2_diagnostic(es_remark, ec_out_of_order_ctor_init, &error_position,
    6671             :                          ctor_init_symbol(new_cip),
    6672             :                          ctor_init_symbol(cibp->last_order_checked_init));
    6673             :       cibp->out_of_order_diag_issued = TRUE;
    6674             :     }  /* if */
    6675             :   }  /* if */
    6676             :   cibp->last_order_checked_init = new_cip;
    6677             : }  /* check_out_of_order_init */
    6678             : 
    6679             : 
    6680        3976 : static a_symbol_ptr look_up_mem_initializer_id(void)
    6681             : /*
    6682             : The current token is a (generalized) identifier of a mem-initializer-id (which
    6683             : could refer to a field or base class to be initialized, or, in the case of a
    6684             : delegating constructor, to the parent class of the constructor itself).  Look
    6685             : up this identifier and return the associated symbol (or NULL if none).
    6686             : */
    6687             : {
    6688        3976 :   a_symbol_ptr               sym;
    6689        3976 :   an_identifier_options_set  gid_options = GID_NO_OPTIONS;
    6690        3976 :   an_identifier_lookup_mode  ilm = ilm_ctor_initializer_name;
    6691        3976 :   a_boolean                  gid_err;
    6692             : 
    6693        3976 :   check_assertion(curr_token == tok_identifier);
    6694        3976 :   if (locator_for_curr_id.is_qualified_name) {
    6695             :     /* A qualified name must name a class. */
    6696           0 :     gid_options |= GID_IMPLICIT_TYPE_CONTEXT;
    6697           0 :     ilm = ilm_qualified_ctor_initializer_name;
    6698             :   }  /* if */
    6699             :   /* Scan the class name or member name.  (The lookup modes used here skip the
    6700             :      current function scope to ensure that a constructor parameter with the
    6701             :      same name as a member or base class is not visible.) */
    6702        3976 :   sym = coalesce_and_lookup_generalized_identifier(gid_options, ilm, &gid_err);
    6703        3976 :   return sym;
    6704             : }  /* look_up_mem_initializer_id */
    6705             : 
    6706             : 
    6707        2374 : static a_constructor_init_ptr scan_mem_initializer_id(
    6708             :                                              a_type_ptr         class_type,
    6709             :                                              a_ctor_init_block  *cibp,
    6710             :                                              a_type_ptr         *p_init_type,
    6711             :                                              a_type_ptr         *p_array_type)
    6712             : /*
    6713             : Scan a mem-initializer-id (i.e., the name of a field or base class or a
    6714             : decltype that denotes a base class to be initialized by a constructor
    6715             : definition) and return a constructor init entry corresponding to it.
    6716             : class_type is the parent class of the constructor.  *cibp tracks the state of
    6717             : the constructor init entries for the constructor currently being defined.
    6718             : *p_init_type is the type to be initialized; in the case of an array, it is the
    6719             : underlying element type and the array type itself is returned through
    6720             : *p_array_type (in non-array cases, *p_array_type is left unchanged).
    6721             : */
    6722             : {
    6723        2374 :   a_symbol_ptr               member_or_base_sym = NULL;
    6724        2374 :   a_type_ptr                 init_type, orig_type = NULL;
    6725        2374 :   a_boolean                  template_param_init = FALSE, is_decltype = FALSE;
    6726        2374 :   a_base_class_ptr           bcp;
    6727        2374 :   a_constructor_init_ptr     cip, new_cip = NULL;
    6728        2374 :   a_source_position          pos = pos_curr_token;
    6729             : 
    6730        2374 :   if (is_decltype_mem_initializer(cibp)) {
    6731             :     /* In C++11 mode, decltype may be used to denote a base class. */
    6732           0 :     is_decltype = TRUE;

    6734             :       /* The first mem-initializer-id in a list may already have been
    6735             :          analyzed to see if it is a delegating constructor, and in cases
    6736             :          where it's not, the pending decltype-specifier type has been stored

    7121        2425 : static void check_constexpr_ctor_init(a_routine_ptr      ctor,
    7122             :                                       an_init_state      *is,
    7123             :                                       a_source_position  *diag_pos)
    7124             : /*

    7126             : constructor.  If ctor is a C++11 constexpr constructor and the initializer is
    7127             : not a constant, either issue an error if the constructor is not a template

    7144             :         invalid_init = TRUE;
    7145             :       } else {
    7146             :         invalid_init = FALSE;
    7147             :       }  /* if */
    7148             :     } else {

    7150             :     }  /* if */
    7151           0 :     if (invalid_init) {

    7222             : static a_boolean init_cache_is_variadic_and_short(an_initializer_cache  *cache)
    7223             : /*
    7224             : Return TRUE if the given initializer cache contains at least one pack
    7225             : expansion and the number of elements in the cache would be less than two if all

    7245        2428 : static void scan_parenthesized_mem_init_args(

    7390           0 :         dip = make_error_constant_dynamic_init();
    7391             :       } else {
    7392             :         /* Using "()" with the mem-initializer means, perform value
    7393             :            initialization.  Note that the class and array-of-class cases have
    7394             :            already been dealt with, so value initialization is tantamount to
    7395             :            zero-initialization (8.5 [dcl.init]). */
    7396           3 :         a_dynamic_init_kind  init_kind = (a_dynamic_init_kind)dik_zero;
    7397           3 :         if ((microsoft_bugs && microsoft_version < 1310 &&
    7398           0 :              emulate_msvc_value_initialization_bugs) ||
    7399           3 :             (gpp_mode && emulate_gnu_value_initialization_bugs &&
    7400           3 :              cip != NULL && cip->kind != (a_constructor_init_kind)cik_field) ||
    7401           0 :             (array_type != NULL && is_incomplete_array_type(array_type))) {
    7402             :           /* MSVC++ up to version 7.0 never initializes the entity in this
    7403             :              case.  g++ up to 3.4 does not initialize base classes.  The
    7404             :              flexible array member case cannot be initialized since the array
    7405             :              has no known number of elements. */
    7406             :           init_kind = (a_dynamic_init_kind)dik_none;
    7407             :         }  /* if */
    7408           3 :         dip = alloc_dynamic_init(init_kind);
    7409             :       }  /* if */
    7410             :     } else {
    7411             :       /* Not default-initialization. */
    7412         947 :       if (list_init_enabled && gpp_mode && array_type != NULL &&
    7413           0 :           is_braced_init_component(icp)) {
    7414             :         /* Something like "S(): array({ 1, 2 }) {}".  A list initializer in a
    7415             :            parenthesized initializer for an array member is not actually valid
    7416             :            per the C++11 standard, but GCC accepts it. */
    7417           0 :         pos_warning(ec_braced_init_in_paren_init, &pos_curr_token);
    7418           0 :         braced_mem_initializer(ctor, array_type, cip, icp);
    7419           0 :         free_init_component_list(icp);

    7422         947 :         if (array_type != NULL && !is_string_type(array_type)) {

    7424             :              expression-list must be omitted.  The exception is a character
    7425             :              array, which can be initialized with a string literal.  GNU C++ is
    7426             :              more permissive and allows initialization with an expression of
    7427             :              the same array type if the elements of the array have a nontrivial
    7428             :              copy constructor. */
    7429           0 :           dip = scan_array_mem_initializer(cip, icp);
    7430           0 :           if (dip == NULL) {
    7431           0 :             expect_error();
    7432           0 :             dip = make_error_constant_dynamic_init();
    7433           0 :             if (anything_cached(&cache)) {
    7434             :               /* Avoid further errors. */
    7435           0 :               flush_initializer_cache(&cache);
    7436             :             }  /* if */
    7437             :           }  /* if */

    7439         947 :           a_decl_parse_state  dps;

    7454             :                   init_component_pos(cache.first_init));

    7458         947 : consume_right_paren:

    7462         950 :     (void)required_token(tok_rparen, ec_exp_rparen);

    7469             : 
    7470           0 : static void handle_missing_mem_init_args(a_constructor_init_ptr  cip)
    7471             : /*
    7472             : A mem-initializer-id has just been scanned and the current token is not a
    7473             : delimiter introducing the arguments for the mem-initializer.  Issue a syntax
    7474             : error and flush tokens as needed.  If cip is non-null, record an error
    7475             : initializer in that entry.
    7476             : */
    7477             : {
    7478           0 :   set_err_pos_to_curr_token();
    7479           0 :   add_stop_token(tok_lparen);
    7480           0 :   if (list_init_enabled) add_stop_token(tok_lbrace);
    7481           0 :   syntax_error(list_init_enabled ? ec_exp_lparen_or_brace : ec_exp_lparen);

    7483           0 :   remove_stop_token(tok_lparen);

    7493             : static void scan_mem_init_args(a_routine_ptr           ctor,
    7494             :                                a_constructor_init_ptr  cip,
    7495             :                                a_type_ptr              init_type,
    7496             :                                a_type_ptr              array_type,
    7497             :                                a_source_position       *pos)
    7498             : /*
    7499             : Scan the arguments of a mem-initializer (including the delimiting parentheses
    7500             : or braces).  ctor is the constructor with which the mem-initializer is
    7501             : associated.  cip describes this particular mem-initializer (it can be NULL in
    7502             : error cases).  For non-array (sub)objects, init_type is the type being
    7503             : initialized and array_type is NULL.
    7504             : For array subobjects, init_type is the underlying element type being
    7505             : initialized and array_type is the array type.  pos is the start position of
    7506             : the mem-initializer.
    7507             : */
    7508             : {
    7509             :   if (curr_token == tok_lparen) {
    7510             :     /* A classic (i.e., parenthesized) mem-initializer argument. */
    7511             :     scan_parenthesized_mem_init_args(ctor, cip, init_type, array_type);
    7512             :   } else if (list_init_enabled && curr_token == tok_lbrace) {
    7513             :     /* A braced (i.e., C++11-style) mem-initializer argument. */
    7514             :     a_type_ptr  dtype = (array_type != NULL) ? array_type : init_type;
    7515             :     braced_mem_initializer(ctor, dtype, cip, (an_init_component*)NULL);
    7516             :   } else {
    7517             :     /* Neither brace nor parenthesis: A syntax error. */
    7518             :     handle_missing_mem_init_args(cip);
    7519             :   }  /* if */
    7520             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
    7521             :   if (cip != NULL) {
    7522             :     cip->ctor_init_range.start = *pos;
    7523             :     cip->ctor_init_range.end = curr_construct_end_position;
    7524             :   }  /* if */
    7525             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
    7526             : }  /* scan_mem_init_args */

    7528             : 
    7529             : static void prescan_mem_init_args(a_ctor_init_block       *cibp,
    7530             :                                   a_constructor_init_ptr  cip,
    7531             :                                   a_type_ptr              init_type,
    7532             :                                   a_type_ptr              array_type,
    7533             :                                   a_source_position       *pos)
    7534             : /*

    7536             : constructor init entry (at this point, tokens are usually being cached as they

    7543             :       (list_init_enabled && curr_token == tok_lbrace)) {
    7544             :     a_mem_init_args_cache_ptr  cache = cibp->pending_mem_init_cache;

    7549             :                                                   CTS_COALESCE_IDS);

    7551             :     (void)get_token();

    7553             :       if (cache == NULL) {
    7554             :         /* Create a cache entry that won't hold tokens, but that still holds
    7555             :            type and position information. */
    7556             :         cache = alloc_mem_init_args_cache();

    7562             :     } else {

    7564             :          discard the cache. */
    7565             :       if (cache != NULL) {
    7566             :         abort_cache_mem_initializer(cibp);

    7572             :     handle_missing_mem_init_args(cip);
    7573             :   }  /* if */

    7575             : 
    7576             : 
    7577        2374 : static a_constructor_init_ptr scan_mem_initializer(
    7578             :                                                 a_routine_ptr      ctor,
    7579             :                                                 a_type_ptr         class_type,
    7580             :                                                 a_ctor_init_block  *cibp)
    7581             : /*
    7582             : Scan a mem-initializer, i.e., the explicit initializer for one subobject in a
    7583             : ctor-initializer list for the given constructor (which is being defined).
    7584             : Return a pointer to the constructor-init entry for the member, or NULL in some
    7585             : error cases.
    7586             : The current token is the identifier naming the member (or an open parenthesis
    7587             : for an old-style initializer case).  class_type identifies the class whose
    7588             : constructor is being defined.  cibp records the state of the constructor init
    7589             : list associated with the constructor.  That list starts off with entries
    7590             : describing default initialization (in order of initialization) and those
    7591             : entries are replaced as needed for each mem-initializer that is encountered.
    7592             : */
    7593             : {
    7594        2374 :   a_type_ptr              init_type, array_type = NULL;
    7595        2374 :   a_constructor_init_ptr  new_cip = NULL;
    7596        2374 :   a_source_position       init_start_pos;
    7597             : 
    7598        2374 :   init_start_pos = pos_curr_token;
    7599             :   /* Unless this is an old style base class initializer, a base class
    7600             :      name, member name, or (in C++11 mode) decltype is expected. */
    7601        2374 :   if (curr_token != tok_lparen &&
    7602        3200 :       !(is_decl_qualified_name_start() || is_decltype_mem_initializer(cibp))) {
    7603             :     /* Either an identifier or "::" is expected here. */
    7604           0 :     syntax_error(ec_exp_identifier);
    7605             :   } else {
    7606        2374 :     if (curr_token == tok_lparen &&
    7607           0 :         cibp->pending_decltype_initializer_type == NULL) {
    7608             :       /* Old-style base class initializer.  It is assumed to apply to the
    7609             :          direct base class (it's allowed only if there is exactly one direct
    7610             :          base class). */
    7611           0 :       a_boolean one_direct_base = (cibp->virtual_list != NULL &&
    7612           0 :                                    cibp->virtual_list->next == NULL &&
    7613           0 :                                    cibp->direct_list == NULL) ||
    7614           0 :                                   (cibp->direct_list != NULL &&
    7615           0 :                                    cibp->direct_list->next == NULL &&
    7616             :                                    cibp->virtual_list == NULL);
    7617           0 :       if (!allow_anachronisms || !one_direct_base) {
    7618             :         /* Either no base classes or more than one. */
    7619           0 :         pos_error(ec_missing_base_class_or_member_name, &init_start_pos);
    7620           0 :         init_type = error_type();
    7621             :       } else {
    7622             :         /* The base class is probably on the direct_list, but if it was
    7623             :            declared virtual it is on the virtual list. */
    7624           0 :         a_base_class_ptr  bcp;
    7625           0 :         new_cip = cibp->direct_list != NULL ? cibp->direct_list
    7626           0 :                                             : cibp->virtual_list;
    7627           0 :         new_cip->compiler_generated = FALSE;
    7628           0 :         bcp = new_cip->variant.base_class;
    7629           0 :         check_assertion(bcp->direct);
    7630           0 :         init_type = bcp->type;
    7631           0 :         pos_ty_diagnostic(anachronism_error_severity,
    7632             :                           ec_base_class_init_anachronism,
    7633             :                           &init_start_pos, init_type);
    7634           0 :         if (new_cip->initializer != NULL) {
    7635           0 :           pos_ty_error(ec_base_class_already_initialized,
    7636             :                        &init_start_pos, init_type);
    7637             :         } else {
    7638           0 :           check_out_of_order_init(new_cip, cibp);
    7639             :         }  /* if */
    7640           0 :         if (cibp->pending_mem_init_cache != NULL) {
    7641           0 :           cibp->pending_mem_init_cache->init_type = init_type;
    7642           0 :           cibp->pending_mem_init_cache->array_type = NULL;
    7643             :         }  /* if */
    7644             :       }  /* if */
    7645             :     } else {
    7646             :       /* Standard case: A mem-initializer that starts with the name of a field,
    7647             :          base class, or (in C++11 mode) a decltype that denotes a base
    7648             :          class. */
    7649        2374 :       new_cip = scan_mem_initializer_id(class_type, cibp, &init_type,
    7650             :                                         &array_type);
    7651             :     }  /* if */
    7652             :     /* The initialization described by mem-initializers must occur in the order
    7653             :        that the corresponding members are declared in.  That can be different
    7654             :        from the order that the mem-initializers appear in.  So we ordinarily
    7655             :        cache the mem-initializer arguments, and process them after we have
    7656             :        seen and ordered all the corresponding mem-initializer-ids.  However,
    7657             :        that doesn't always work during the prototype instantiation of variadic
    7658             :        templates.  For example:
    7659             :          template<typename ... Ts> struct S: Ts ... {
    7660             :            S(Ts ... ts): Ts(ts) ... {}
    7661             :          }
    7662             :        Here the reference to ts in "Ts(ts)" must be recorded before the
    7663             :        subsequent ellipsis is seen.  For that case we therefore parse the
    7664             :        mem-initializer arguments immediately.  That is not a problem in
    7665             :        prototype instantiations, since no actual code is generated from
    7666             :        them. */
    7667        2374 :     if (ctor->is_prototype_instantiation) {
    7668        1687 :       scan_mem_init_args(ctor, new_cip, init_type, array_type,
    7669             :                          &init_start_pos);
    7670             :     } else {
    7671         687 :       prescan_mem_init_args(cibp, new_cip, init_type, array_type,
    7672             :                             &init_start_pos);
    7673             :     }  /* if */
    7674             :   }  /* if */
    7675        2374 :   return new_cip;
    7676             : }  /* scan_mem_initializer */
    7677             : 
    7678             : 
    7679         201 : static void check_variant_has_initializer(
    7680             :                                a_constructor_init_ptr  cip,
    7681             :                                a_boolean               *variant_init,
    7682             :                                a_boolean               *variant_explicit_init)
    7683             : /*
    7684             : cip points to the constructor init entry for the first variant member of an
    7685             : anonymous union.  Look through all the entries for that anonymous union to see
    7686             : if it contains an actual initialization (in which case *variant_init is set to
    7687             : TRUE).  If it contains an explicit initialization (i.e., not one implied by a
    7688             : field initializer), set *variant_explicit_init to TRUE.
    7689             : */
    7690             : {
    7691         201 :   a_boolean  first_entry = TRUE;
    7692             : 
    7693         402 :   for (; cip != NULL; cip = cip->next) {
    7694         402 :     a_dynamic_init_ptr  dip = cip->initializer;
    7695         402 :     a_field_ptr         fp;
    7696         402 :     check_assertion(cip->kind == (a_constructor_init_kind)cik_field);
    7697         402 :     fp = cip->variant.field;
    7698         402 :     if ((dip != NULL && dip->kind != (a_dynamic_init_kind)dik_none) ||
    7699         201 :         (!first_entry && cip->source.arg_cache != NULL)) {
    7700             :       /* An explicit initializer. */
    7701           0 :       *variant_explicit_init = TRUE;
    7702           0 :       *variant_init = TRUE;
    7703           0 :       break;
    7704         402 :     } else if (fp->has_initializer) {
    7705             :       /* No explicit mem-initializer, but the field has an associated
    7706             :          in-class initializer. */
    7707           0 :       *variant_init = TRUE;
    7708             :       /* Continue in case an explicit initializer is present (which would
    7709             :          supersede a field initializer). */
    7710             :     }  /* if */
    7711         402 :     if (symbol_for(fp)->variant.field.extra_info->is_last_variant_member) {
    7712             :       /* Any subsequent members are not part of this variant.  End the search
    7713             :          here. */
    7714             :       break;
    7715             :     }  /* if */
    7716         201 :     first_entry = FALSE;
    7717             :   }  /* for */
    7718         201 : }  /* check_variant_has_initializer */
    7719             : 
    7720             : 
    7721           0 : static a_dynamic_init_ptr repeat_mem_init_for_array(a_dynamic_init_ptr  dip,
    7722             :                                                     a_type_ptr          atype)
    7723             : /*
    7724             : dip represents the initialization of a constructible element of an array of the
    7725             : given type.  Return a corresponding dynamic initializer entry to initialize the
    7726             : whole array.
    7727             : */
    7728             : {
    7729           0 :   a_dynamic_init_ptr  result;
    7730           0 :   a_type_ptr          etype = underlying_array_element_type(atype);
    7731             : 
    7732           0 :   etype = skip_typerefs(etype);
    7733           0 :   if (dip->kind == (a_dynamic_init_kind)dik_constant &&
    7734           0 :       dip->destructor == NULL) {
    7735             :     /* We get here with folded constexpr constructor calls. */
    7736           0 :     a_constant_ptr  econ = dip->variant.constant, acon;
    7737           0 :     check_assertion(econ->is_result_of_constexpr_call);
    7738           0 :     acon = alloc_constant((a_constant_repr_kind)ck_aggregate);
    7739           0 :     acon->type = atype;
    7740           0 :     add_constant_to_aggregate(
    7741           0 :                       add_repeat_con(econ, array_element_count(atype, etype)),
    7742             :                       acon);
    7743           0 :     dip->variant.constant = acon;
    7744           0 :     result = dip;
    7745             :   } else {
    7746           0 :     result =
    7747           0 :            alloc_dynamic_init((a_dynamic_init_kind)dik_nonconstant_aggregate);
    7748             :     /* Build the looping constant entry. */
    7749           0 :     repeat_nonconstant_init(dip, atype, etype, result,
    7750           0 :                             array_element_count(atype, etype));
    7751           0 :     if (dip->destructor != NULL) {
    7752             :       /* A destructor is recorded in the array element dynamic-init entry.
    7753             :          This is in case an exception is thrown in the midst of constructing
    7754             :          the array, so that the already-constructed elements can be properly
    7755             :          destroyed. */
    7756           0 :       check_assertion(exceptions_enabled);
    7757           0 :       dip->destruction_is_for_partially_constructed_aggregate = TRUE;
    7758             :       /* The dynamic init for the array as a whole should also indicate
    7759             :          destruction. */
    7760           0 :       record_dtor_in_dynamic_init(dip->destructor, result, /*evaluated=*/TRUE);
    7761           0 :       record_end_of_lifetime_destruction(result, /*static_lifetime=*/FALSE,
    7762             :                                          /*block_lifetime=*/TRUE);
    7763             :     }  /* if */
    7764             :   }  /* if */
    7765           0 :   result->is_constructor_init = TRUE;
    7766           0 :   return result;
    7767             : }  /* repeat_mem_init_for_array */
    7768             : 
    7769             : 
    7770             : /*
    7771             : Pointer to a hash table tracking the targets of delegating constructors.
    7772             : (We cannot use the IL because constructor definitions may be discarded early.)
    7773             : Each entry in the table maps a routine entry for a delegating constructor to
    7774             : a non-delegating constructor it (possibly indirectly) delegates construction
    7775             : to.
    7776             : */
    7777             : static a_hash_table_ptr
    7778             :         ctor_delegation_map;
    7779             : 
    7780             : 
    7781             : /*
    7782             : Type of the data items pointed to by the delegation map.
    7783             : */
    7784             : typedef struct a_void_pointer_pair {
    7785             :   a_void_ptr
    7786             :         key;
    7787             :                 /* The delegating constructor. */
    7788             :   a_void_ptr
    7789             :         value;
    7790             :                 /* The target construct. */
    7791             : } a_void_pointer_pair;
    7792             : 
    7793             : 
    7794          24 : a_hash_value hash_void_pointer(a_void_ptr  p)
    7795             : /*
    7796             : Return a hash value for the given pointer.
    7797             : */
    7798             : {
    7799          24 :   a_hash_value  h = (a_hash_value)possible_lossy_cast_from_pointer(p);
    7800             :   /* Jenkins integer hashing algorithm: */
    7801          24 :   h -= (h<<6);
    7802          24 :   h ^= (h>>17);
    7803          24 :   h -= (h<<9);
    7804          24 :   h ^= (h<<4);
    7805          24 :   h -= (h<<3);
    7806          24 :   h ^= (h<<10);
    7807          24 :   h ^= (h>>15);
    7808          24 :   return h;
    7809             : }  /* hash_void_pointer */
    7810             : 
    7811             : 
    7812           0 : a_boolean compare_for_pointer_pair_map(a_void_ptr  entry,
    7813             :                                        a_void_ptr  key)
    7814             : /*
    7815             : Entry points to a void pointer pair.  Return TRUE if the pair's key equals key.
    7816             : */
    7817             : {
    7818           0 :   return ((a_void_pointer_pair*)entry)->key == key;
    7819             : }  /* compare_for_pointer_pair_map */
    7820             : 
    7821             : 
    7822          24 : static void record_nondelegating_target_ctor(a_routine_ptr  ctor,
    7823             :                                              a_routine_ptr  target)
    7824             : /*
    7825             : Record in ctor_delegation_map the nondelegating target constructor (target) to
    7826             : which ctor delegates initialization.
    7827             : */
    7828             : {
    7829          24 :   a_void_pointer_pair **p_pair;
    7830             :

    7836             :                                fn_for_function(compare_for_pointer_pair_map));

    7839             :                       ctor_delegation_map, (a_void_ptr)ctor, /*create=*/TRUE);

    7845             : 
    7846             : 
    7847          24 : static a_routine_ptr get_nondelegating_target_ctor(a_routine_ptr  ctor)
    7848             : /*

    7850             : constructor is itself a delegating constructor, return the non-delegating
    7851             : constructor it targets.  Otherwise, just return ctor.

    7854          24 :   a_routine_ptr       target;
    7855          24 :   a_void_pointer_pair **p_pair;
    7856             :

    7881             : 
    7882        1602 : static a_boolean delegating_ctor_initializer(a_routine_ptr      ctor,
    7883             :                                              a_ctor_init_block  *cibp)
    7884             : /*
    7885             : The current token is the one following a colon (":") presumably introducing
    7886             : mem-initializers for the given constructor.  If what follows is a
    7887             : mem-initializer for a delegating constructor, return TRUE and update *cibp to
    7888             : reflect the initialization.  Otherwise, return FALSE.
    7889             : 
    7890             : In cases where a decltype-specifier is the next token in the stream, the
    7891             : decltype-specifier is consumed here and, if found not to be a delegating
    7892             : constructor, the scanned type is stored for later use.
    7893             : */
    7894             : {
    7895        1602 :   a_boolean  is_delegating_init = FALSE, is_decltype = FALSE;
    7896             :

    7902             :       /* An empty pack expansion. */

    7904             :         /* Additional mem-initializers follow: Iterate to see if the next one
    7905             :            is a delegating initializer. */

    7909           0 :         cibp->has_explicit_init = FALSE;

    8089             : 
    8090             : 
    8091        2044 : a_constructor_init_ptr ctor_initializer(a_routine_ptr  ctor_rout,
    8092             :                                         a_boolean      user_defined)
    8093             : /*
    8094             : Process the explicit and implicit constructor initializations for constructor
    8095             : routine ctor_rout.  If user_defined is TRUE, the context is that of an
    8096             : explicit definition in the source code; otherwise, this routine is called
    8097             : as part of the implicit definition of a compiler generated constructor.
    8098             : 
    8099             : If user_defined is TRUE, scan a comma-separated list of mem-initializers
    8100             : for data members and/or base classes, if any.  If present, the current
    8101             : token should be the colon introducing that list.  The special case of
    8102             : a delegating constructor (a feature introduced in C++11) is also handled
    8103             : here.
    8104             : 
    8105             : The implicit initializations are performed for base classes and class-type
    8106             : data members for which no explicit initializers were specified and for which
    8107             : constructor initialization is required; in such cases default constructors
    8108             : are invoked.
    8109             : 
    8110             : In addition, when ctor_rout refers to a generated copy constructor, all
    8111             : nonstatic data members are initialized (for bitwise copy at least) and all
    8112             : implicitly invoked constructors for member and base class subobjects must
    8113             : also be copy constructors.
    8114             : 
    8115             : There are rules governing order of initialization, virtual base classes, and
    8116             : which subobjects require initialization and therefore must be implicitly
    8117             : initialized.  These are addressed in the course of the processing.
    8118             : */
    8119             : {
    8120        2044 :   a_boolean                     is_union;
    8121        2044 :   a_boolean                     has_field = FALSE, has_field_init = FALSE;
    8122        2044 :   a_boolean                     has_explicit_field_init = FALSE;
    8123        2044 :   a_boolean                     is_generated_cctor, is_generated_mctor;
    8124        2044 :   a_type_qualifier_set          required_qualifiers, object_qualifiers;
    8125        2044 :   a_type_ptr                    class_type, tp = NULL, array_type;

    8127        2044 :   a_ctor_init_block             cib;

    8129        2044 :   a_base_class_ptr              bcp;

    8152        2044 :   cib.out_of_order_diag_issued = FALSE;

    8154        2044 :   if (user_defined && curr_token == tok_colon) {
    8155             :     /* User-specified initializers are present. */
    8156        1602 :     cib.has_explicit_init = TRUE;
    8157             :     /* Bypass the colon. */
    8158        1602 :     (void)get_token();
    8159             :     /* Check for the case of a delegating constructor. */
    8160             :     /* This requires starting a potential pack expansion context at this time.
    8161             :        That context may then be used later on when scanning ordinary
    8162             :        mem-initializers if this isn't a delegating constructor (or in some
    8163             :        error cases that mix the delegating constructor initializer with
    8164             :        ordinary subobject initializers). */

    8166             :        constructor or a base class specifier; if a decltype-specifier is

    8175             :   }  /* if */

    8188        1990 :   if (user_defined) {

    8191        1892 :     required_qualifiers = TQ_NONE;
    8192         196 :   } else if (move_operations_can_be_defaulted() &&
    8193          98 :              routine_is_move_constructor(ctor_rout)) {
    8194          54 :     is_generated_cctor = FALSE;
    8195          54 :     is_generated_mctor = TRUE;
    8196          54 :     required_qualifiers = TQ_NONE;
    8197             :   } else {
    8198          44 :     is_generated_cctor = is_copy_constructor(ctor_rout, class_type,
    8199             :                                              &required_qualifiers,
    8200             :                                              rvalue_ctor_is_copy_ctor,
    8201             :                                              /*is_declarative_context=*/TRUE);
    8202          44 :     is_generated_mctor = FALSE;
    8203             :   }  /* if */
    8204             :   /* The first step is to construct three lists of constructor initializer
    8205             :      entries, one for virtual base classes that have constructors, one for
    8206             :      nonvirtual direct base classes that have constructors, and one for
    8207             :      nonstatic data members that have constructors.  The entries on these
    8208             :      lists identify all base classes and fields that *must* be initialized
    8209             :      when the constructor is called; in addition, the third list may be
    8210             :      supplemented by explicit initializers of fields without constructors.
    8211             :      Eventually these three lists will be merged into one.  The order of
    8212             :      items on the list is the order in which initializations are to be
    8213             :      performed. */
    8214             :   /* Handle the first two lists together. */
    8215             :   /* Scan the list of base classes, which may include some that are
    8216             :      ineligible for initialization. */
    8217        3223 :   for (bcp = ctsp->base_classes; bcp != NULL; bcp = bcp->next) {
    8218        1233 :     if (bcp->direct || bcp->is_virtual) {
    8219        1066 :       cssp = symbol_supplement_for_class(bcp->type);
    8220             :       /* If the virtual base class or direct base class has a constructor, a
    8221             :          dynamic init entry will be required; otherwise it is optional.
    8222             :          Create the constructor init entry now; the dynamic init will be added
    8223             :          later. */
    8224        1066 :       cip = alloc_ctor_init((a_constructor_init_kind)(bcp->is_virtual ?
    8225             :                                                       cik_virtual_base_class :
    8226             :                                                       cik_direct_base_class));
    8227        1066 :       cip->variant.base_class = bcp;
    8228             :       /* Mark the constructor initializer as compiler-generated (i.e., not
    8229             :          representing an explicit entry in the ctor-initializer list); clear
    8230             :          the flag later if appropriate. */
    8231        1066 :       cip->compiler_generated = TRUE;
    8232             :       /* Add the constructor init to the end of the appropriate list. */
    8233        1066 :       if (bcp->is_virtual) {

    8426             :   /* The following loop proceeds through the merged constructor-init list,
    8427             :      which now reflects the canonical order of base-class and member
    8428             :      initializations (i.e., as required by the language definition, not the
    8429             :      order that appeared in the source).  The body of the loop does several
    8430             :      things:
    8431             :        (1) For explicit initializations, it completes processing of the
    8432             :            cached initializers (except for prototype instantiations, where
    8433             :            processing has been completed already).
    8434             :        (2) It does the processing for implicit initializations:
    8435             :            (a) special handling for generated copy/move constructor; or
    8436             :            (b) processing for user-defined constructor or generated default
    8437             :                constructor.
    8438             :            Note: unneeded ctor-init entries are removed from the list.
    8439             :        (3) If exceptions are enabled, the destructor is recorded in the
    8440             :            dynamic init entry (in case an exception is thrown during
    8441             :            construction of the object).

    8664             :              also accept such objects for copying (a conclusion based in part

    9058        1990 :   if (clear_constexpr_flag) {
    9059           0 :     ctor_rout->is_constexpr = FALSE;
    9060             :   }  /* if */
    9061             : #if NEW_CAN_BE_FOLDED_INTO_CTOR
    9062        1990 :   if (ctor_rout->is_trivial_default_constructor && !ctor_rout->is_defaulted) {
    9063             :     /* IL will not be put out for an implicitly-generated trivial default
    9064             :        constructor anyway, so there's no need to deal with default operator
    9065             :        new. */
    9066             :   } else {
    9067             :     /* Determine and remember the default operator new() routine for the
    9068             :        class.  This is done here because we are working out the "wrapper"
    9069             :        code that will be required, and the "new" routine will be called from
    9070             :        the wrapper. */
    9071        1958 :     a_routine_ptr new_routine;
    9072        1958 :     set_class_assoc_operator_new_routine(class_type);
    9073        1958 :     new_routine = ctsp->assoc_operator_new_routine;
    9074        1958 :     if (new_routine != NULL) {
    9075         794 :       mark_routine_referenced(new_routine);
    9076         794 :       new_routine->called = TRUE;

    9078         794 :         a_routine_ptr delete_routine;

    9080             :            delete the storage allocated if an exception is thrown, so it
    9081             :            needs the delete routine too. */
    9082         794 :         set_class_assoc_operator_delete_routine(class_type);

    9085         794 :           mark_routine_referenced(delete_routine);

    9088             :       }  /* if */
    9089             :     }  /* if */
    9090             :   }  /* if */
    9091             : #endif /* NEW_CAN_BE_FOLDED_INTO_CTOR */

    9095             :               "constructor: ", 2);
    9096           0 :     for (cip = cib.cip_list; cip != NULL; cip = cip->next) {
    9097           0 :       if (cip->kind == (a_constructor_init_kind)cik_field) {
    9098           0 :         sym = symbol_for(cip->variant.field);

    9100           0 :         sym = symbol_for(cip->variant.base_class->type);

    9118             : 
    9119             : 
    9120         445 : a_constructor_init_ptr dtor_initializer(a_routine_ptr  dtor_rout)
    9121             : /*
    9122             : Return a list of constructor-init entries describing implicit destructor
    9123             : calls required when the destructor dtor_rout is invoked.  (Constructor-init
    9124             : entries are used because of the similarity to constructor processing, even
    9125             : though neither constructors nor initialization is involved here.)
    9126             : */
    9127             : {
    9128         445 :   a_type_ptr                    class_type, tp;
    9129         445 :   a_symbol_ptr                  sym, class_sym;
    9130         445 :   a_constructor_init_ptr        cip;
    9131         445 :   a_boolean                     is_virtual_pass;
    9132         445 :   a_constructor_init_ptr        cip_list;
    9133         445 :   a_routine_ptr                 rp;
    9134         445 :   a_base_class_ptr              bcp;
    9135         445 :   a_dynamic_init_ptr            dip;
    9136         445 :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr   ctsp;
    9137         445 :   a_source_position             source_pos;
    9138         445 :   a_boolean                     in_variant = FALSE, variant_complete = FALSE;
    9139             : 
    9140         445 :   db_enter(3, "dtor_initializer");
    9141         445 :   cip_list = NULL;
    9142         445 :   class_type = parent_class_of(dtor_rout);
    9143         445 :   check_assertion(class_type != NULL);
    9144         445 :   ctsp = class_type_supp(class_type);
    9145         445 :   source_pos = dtor_rout->source_corresp.decl_position;
    9146         445 :   if (class_type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_union) {
    9147             :     /* Subobjects of variant members are not automatically destroyed.  So
    9148             :        nothing must be done for unions.  (Anonymous union members are handled
    9149             :        below.) */
    9150           0 :     goto past_subobject_destructions;
    9151             :   }  /* if */
    9152             :   /* The order of destructor calls is exactly the reverse of the order of
    9153             :      constructor calls.  In other words, destructors for virtual base classes
    9154             :      are last, preceded by destructors for nonvirtual direct base classes,
    9155             :      with destructors for members coming first (ARM 12.4).  Thus we follow the
    9156             :      logic in ctor_initializer, except that the lists are built backwards and
    9157             :      merged backwards.   First construct the lists for virtual base classes
    9158             :      and nonvirtual direct base classes. */
    9159             :   /* First loop through the base classes looking for virtual base classes.
    9160             :      Do not do this for abstract classes. */
    9161         445 :   is_virtual_pass = !class_type->variant.class_struct_union.abstract;
    9162         882 :   for (;;) {
    9163        1324 :     for (bcp = ctsp->base_classes; bcp != NULL; bcp = bcp->next) {
    9164             :       /* On the first pass select out virtual base classes; on the second
    9165             :          pass select out direct non-virtual base classes. */
    9166         671 :       if (is_virtual_pass ? bcp->is_virtual :
    9167         229 :                             (bcp->direct && !bcp->is_virtual)) {
    9168             :         /* If the virtual base class or direct base class has a destructor, a
    9169             :            dynamic init entry will be required. */
    9170         196 :         rp = select_destructor(bcp->type, class_type, &source_pos);
    9171         196 :         if (rp != NULL) {
    9172         115 :           cip = alloc_ctor_init((a_constructor_init_kind)
    9173             :                                                     (bcp->is_virtual ?
    9174             :                                                      cik_virtual_base_class :
    9175             :                                                      cik_direct_base_class));
    9176         115 :           cip->variant.base_class = bcp;
    9177         115 :           cip->compiler_generated = TRUE;
    9178             :           /* Create a dynamic init entry. */
    9179         115 :           dip = alloc_dynamic_init((a_dynamic_init_kind)dik_none);
    9180         115 :           dip->is_constructor_init = TRUE;
    9181         115 :           record_dtor_in_dynamic_init(rp, dip, /*is_evaluated=*/TRUE);
    9182         115 :           if (exceptions_enabled) {
    9183             :             /* Create a destruction entry and associate it with the
    9184             :                appropriate object-lifetime entry. */
    9185         115 :             record_end_of_lifetime_destruction(dip, /*static_lifetime=*/FALSE,
    9186             :                                                /*block_lifetime=*/TRUE);
    9187             :           }  /* if */
    9188             :           /* Attach the new dynamic init entry to the constructor
    9189             :              initializer. */
    9190         115 :           cip->initializer = dip;
    9191             :           /* Add the constructor init to the end of the appropriate list. */
    9192         115 :           cip->next = cip_list;
    9193         115 :           cip_list = cip;
    9194             :         }  /* if */
    9195             :       }  /* if */
    9196             :     }  /* for */
    9197         882 :     if (is_virtual_pass) {
    9198             :       /* Repeat the loop through the base classes, this time picking up the
    9199             :          direct base classes. */
    9200             :       is_virtual_pass = FALSE;
    9201             :     } else {
    9202             :       /* Only go through twice. */
    9203             :       break;
    9204             :     }  /* if */
    9205             :   }  /* for */

    9207             :      Loop through the symbol list for the class, not the field list, since
    9208             :      the symbol list contains only user-defined fields whereas the field
    9209             :      list may also include compiler-generated field entries. */

    9211         445 :   for (sym = class_sym->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info->symbols;

    9214        9095 :     if (sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_field) {
    9215             :       /* sym represents a field.  Determine whether a destructor exists. */

    9278         445 : past_subobject_destructions:
    9279             :   /* If the destructor is virtual, the class must have a visible
