    9361             : 
    9362             : 
    9363        1204 : void check_for_missing_initializer_full(a_symbol_ptr  sym,
    9364             :                                         a_type_ptr    type,
    9365             :                                         a_boolean     explicitly_internal,
    9366             :                                         a_boolean     *err)
    9367             : /*
    9368             : This routine is called when no explicit, value, or default initialization has
    9369             : occurred.  It determines whether an initializer should have been provided and,
    9370             : if so, sets *err to TRUE if err is non-NULL or issues a diagnostic otherwise.
    9371             : It is used both for variable declarations (when sym represents the variable)
    9372             : and for unnamed objects that are created by a new-expression or a functional
    9373             : notation cast (in which case sym is NULL).  In both cases "type" points to the
    9374             : type of the object.  explicitly_internal is TRUE in the case of a variable
    9375             : declaration that has internal linkage because of the explicit presence of a
    9376             : "static" storage class specifier. 
    9377             : */
    9378             : {
    9379        1204 :   a_variable_ptr       vp;
    9380        1204 :   a_boolean            init_required;
    9381        1204 :   a_base_class_ptr     bcp;
    9382        1204 :   an_error_severity    severity;
    9383        1204 :   a_boolean            is_incomplete_array = FALSE;
    9384             : 
    9385        1204 :   db_enter(4, "check_for_missing_initializer_full");
    9386        1204 :   if (sym != NULL) {
    9387             :     /* This must be a variable or static data member declaration. */
    9388        1151 :     check_assertion(sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_variable ||
    9389             :                     sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_static_data_member);
    9390             :     /* For such declarations, diagnostics should always be enabled. */
    9391        1151 :     check_assertion(err == NULL);
    9392        1151 :     vp = (sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_variable) ? 
    9393        1151 :           sym->variant.variable.ptr : sym->variant.static_data_member.variable;
    9394             :   } else {
    9395             :     /* This must be a "new" expression or functional-notation cast. */
    9396             :     vp = NULL;
    9397             :   }  /* if */
    9398        1204 :   if (is_any_reference_type(type)) {
    9399             :     /* Note that a reference type object cannot be produced by new. */
    9400             :     /* coverity[var_deref_op] */
    9401           0 :     if (vp->storage_class != (a_storage_class)sc_extern) {
    9402             :       /* Non-extern reference variables must be initialized (ARM 8.4.3). */
    9403           0 :       sym_error(ec_missing_initializer_on_reference, sym);
    9404             :     }  /* if */
    9405        1204 :   } else if (is_const_qualified_type(type)) {
    9406           0 :     if (is_array_type(type)) {
    9407           0 :       if (is_incomplete_type(type)) is_incomplete_array = TRUE;
    9408           0 :       type = underlying_array_element_type(type);
    9409             :     }  /* if */
    9410           0 :     if (vp != NULL) {
    9411             :       /* Uninitialized const variable.  In C++ this is permitted only for
    9412             :          externally linked variables (without an initializer, they are not
    9413             :          definitions), but not for static data member definitions.
    9414             :          In ordinary C we issue a warning for local variables (both static
    9415             :          and automatic) here, but the warning for static file scope variables
    9416             :          is given later. */
    9417           0 :       a_name_linkage_kind  name_linkage =
    9418           0 :                          (a_name_linkage_kind)vp->source_corresp.name_linkage;
    9419           0 :       if (C_dialect == C_dialect_cplusplus) {
    9420           0 :         if (name_linkage == (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_none ||
    9421           0 :             ((name_linkage == (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_internal ||
    9422           0 :               vp->is_inline) &&
    9423           0 :              decl_scope_level <= depth_innermost_namespace_scope) ||
    9424             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    9425             :             ((vp->decl_modifiers & DM_DLLEXPORT) != 0 &&
    9426             :              vp->storage_class != (a_storage_class)sc_extern) ||
    9427             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    9428           0 :             symbol_is(sym, sk_static_data_member) ||
    9429           0 :             (sym->is_class_member && vp->is_constexpr)) {
    9430             :           /* In C++ const qualified variables that are internally linked
    9431             :              must be initialized (ARM 7.1.6). */
    9432           0 :           if (could_be_dependent_class_type(type)) {
    9433             :             /* If the type is dependent and could end up being a class type
    9434             :                after substitution no diagnostic should be issued since the
    9435             :                substituting class type may have a default constructor. */
    9436           0 :           } else if (is_const_default_constructible(type)) {
    9437             :             /* The resolution of Core issue 253 (via paper P0490R0) defined
    9438             :                const-default-constructible types, which do not require an
    9439             :                initializer in these cases.  Although originally described as
    9440             :                a defect against C++14, it is universal practice to apply the
    9441             :                revised rules in all modes. */
    9442             :           } else {
    9443             :             /* By default, the diagnostic is an error. */
    9444           0 :             severity = es_error;
    9445           0 :             if (microsoft_mode) {
    9446             :               if (is_class_struct_union_type(type) || is_enum_type(type)) {
    9447             :                 /* MSVC++ does not require an initializer for a const class or
    9448             :                    enum variable with no default constructor. */
    9449             :                 severity = es_warning;
    9450             :               } else if (explicitly_internal) {
    9451             :                 /* It is probably a bug that MSVC++ has different behavior on
    9452             :                    the following:
    9453             :                      const int i;         // Error (no initializer)
    9454             :                      static const int j;  // No diagnostic
    9455             :                 */
    9456             :                 severity = es_warning;
    9457             :               }  /* if */
    9458             :             }  /* if */
    9459           0 :             if (gpp_mode && symbol_is(sym, sk_static_data_member) &&
    9460           0 :                 is_prototype_instantiation_context()) {
    9461             :               /* g++ fails to diagnose a missing initializer for a static
    9462             :                  data member at template definition time.  An error is
    9463             :                  issued if the template is instantiated. */
    9464           0 :               severity = es_warning;
    9465             :             }  /* if */
    9466           0 :             if (is_class_struct_union_type(type) && !is_incomplete_array &&
    9467           0 :                 !any_cfront_mode() && !microsoft_mode) {
    9468             :                /* Even if the class has an implicitly declared default
    9469             :                   constructor, a user-declared default constructor must be
    9470             :                   present (WP 7.1.5.1 [dcl.cv]). */
    9471           0 :               check_assertion(
    9472             :                       !type_has_user_provided_default_constructor(type));
    9473           0 :               pos_syty_diagnostic(severity,
    9474             :                                   ec_missing_default_constructor_on_const,
    9475           0 :                                   &error_position, sym, skip_typerefs(type));
    9476             :             } else {
    9477             :               /* Issue an error or warning on omitting the initializer. */

    9491             :         }  /* if */
    9492             :       }  /* if */
    9493             :     } else {
    9494             :       /* Uninitialized const new-object. 
    9495             :          The case of a const temporary, as in:
    9496             :            typedef X const CX; CX().f();
    9497             :          also comes here (when X has no explicit default constructor). */
    9498           0 :       if (is_const_default_constructible(type) ||
    9499           0 :           any_cfront_mode() || microsoft_mode) {
    9500             :           /* The resolution of Core issue 253 (via paper P0490R0) defined
    9501             :              const-default-constructible types, which do not require an
    9502             :              initializer in these cases.  Although originally described as
    9503             :              a defect against C++14, it is universal practice to apply the
    9504             :              revised rules in all modes. */
    9505             :           /* Microsoft and Cfront do not diagnose these cases even if the
    9506             :              type is not const-default-constructible. */
    9507             :       } else {
    9508             :         /* Issue a discretionary error. */
    9509           0 :         if (is_class_struct_union_type(type)) {

    9515           0 :             if (is_effective_sfinae_error(

    9543             :       /* In C, no diagnostic on unions with const members. */

    9549             :          const qualified field or a field of reference type.  Note that this
    9550             :          check is not explicitly mandated by the ARM (though it is implied in
    9551             :          12.6.2:  "The argument list . . . is the only way to initialize
    9552             :          nonstatic const and reference members").  Cfront issues an error on
    9553             :          class declarations that contain nonstatic const or reference members
    9554             :          and no constructor, but this seems to introduce an unnecessary

    9557          63 :       if (type->variant.class_struct_union.any_const_member ||

    9563          63 :       } else if (C_dialect == C_dialect_cplusplus) {

    9572             :                that is not being initialized. */
    9573             :             init_required = TRUE;
    9574             :             break;

    9576             :         }  /* for */

    9581           0 :           an_error_code code;

    9610         320 : void decl_inits_one_time_init(void)
    9611             : /*
    9612             : Do one-time initialization of variables related to initialization processing.
    9613             : (Variables that need to be reinitialized with each new translation unit are
    9614             : handled in decl_inits_init.)

    9617             :   /* Save variables that are needed for precompiled headers */

    9629             :   /* Register variables (and arrays) that have distinct copies for distinct

    9637             :

    9639         320 : void decl_inits_trans_unit_init(void)
    9640             : /*
    9641             : Initialize static variables related to initialization processing.  These are
    9642             : variables that need initialization for every (primary and secondary)
    9643             : translation unit.
    9644             : */

    9646         320 :   ctor_delegation_map = NULL;
    9647         320 :   field_for_curr_field_initializer = NULL;
    9648             : #if NEED_NAME_MANGLING
    9649         320 :   last_discriminator_for_curr_field_initializer = 0;

    9652             : 
    9653             : 
    9654         320 : void decl_inits_init(void)
    9655             : /*
    9656             : Initialize static variables related to initialization processing.  This is
    9657             : done as a subroutine (rather than relying on static initialization) so that it
    9658             : can be redone to compile more than one source file in a single invocation of
    9659             : the front end.
    9660             : */
    9661             : {
    9662         320 :   avail_mem_init_args_caches = NULL;
    9663             : #if DEBUG
    9664         320 :   num_mem_init_args_caches_allocated = 0;
    9665             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    9666         320 : }  /* decl_inits_init */
